summary.long: Psalm is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text:
Blessed is the one
    who does not walk in step with the wicked
or stand in the way that sinners take
    or sit in the company of mockers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but whose delight is in the law of the Lord,
    and who meditates on his law day and night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That person is like a tree planted by streams of water,
    which yields its fruit in season
and whose leaf does not wither—
    whatever they do prospers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Not so the wicked!
    They are like chaff
    that the wind blows away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment,
    nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord watches over the way of the righteous,
    but the way of the wicked leads to destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do the nations conspire
    and the peoples plot in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth rise up
    and the rulers band together
    against the Lord and against his anointed, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Let us break their chains
    and throw off their shackles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The One enthroned in heaven laughs;
    the Lord scoffs at them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rebukes them in his anger
    and terrifies them in his wrath, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have installed my king
    on Zion, my holy mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Ask me,
    and I will make the nations your inheritance,
    the ends of the earth your possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will break them with a rod of iron;
    you will dash them to pieces like pottery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, you kings, be wise;
    be warned, you rulers of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Serve the Lord with fear
    and celebrate his rule with trembling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kiss his son, or he will be angry
    and your way will lead to your destruction,
for his wrath can flare up in a moment.
    Blessed are all who take refuge in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, how many are my foes!
    How many rise up against me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are saying of me,
    “God will not deliver him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, Lord, are a shield around me,
    my glory, the One who lifts my head high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call out to the Lord,
    and he answers me from his holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lie down and sleep;
    I wake again, because the Lord sustains me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not fear though tens of thousands
    assail me on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, Lord!
    Deliver me, my God!
Strike all my enemies on the jaw;
    break the teeth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the Lord comes deliverance.
    May your blessing be on your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer me when I call to you,
    my righteous God.
Give me relief from my distress;
    have mercy on me and hear my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you people turn my glory into shame?
    How long will you love delusions and seek false gods?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Know that the Lord has set apart his faithful servant for himself;
    the Lord hears when I call to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Offer the sacrifices of the righteous
    and trust in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many, Lord, are asking, “Who will bring us prosperity?”
    Let the light of your face shine on us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fill my heart with joy
    when their grain and new wine abound.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to my words, Lord,
    consider my lament.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my cry for help,
    my King and my God,
    for to you I pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For you are not a God who is pleased with wickedness;
    with you, evil people are not welcome.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
you destroy those who tell lies.
The bloodthirsty and deceitful
    you, Lord, detest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I, by your great love,
    can come into your house;
in reverence I bow down
    toward your holy temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lead me, Lord, in your righteousness
    because of my enemies—
    make your way straight before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Declare them guilty, O God!
    Let their intrigues be their downfall.
Banish them for their many sins,
    for they have rebelled against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But let all who take refuge in you be glad;
    let them ever sing for joy.
Spread your protection over them,
    that those who love your name may rejoice in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely, Lord, you bless the righteous;
    you surround them with your favor as with a shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger
    or discipline me in your wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy on me, Lord, for I am faint;
    heal me, Lord, for my bones are in agony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul is in deep anguish.
    How long, Lord, how long?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn, Lord, and deliver me;
    save me because of your unfailing love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Among the dead no one proclaims your name.
    Who praises you from the grave?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am worn out from my groaning.
All night long I flood my bed with weeping
    and drench my couch with tears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes grow weak with sorrow;
    they fail because of all my foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Away from me, all you who do evil,
    for the Lord has heard my weeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has heard my cry for mercy;
    the Lord accepts my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All my enemies will be overwhelmed with shame and anguish;
    they will turn back and suddenly be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord my God, I take refuge in you;
    save and deliver me from all who pursue me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
or they will tear me apart like a lion
    and rip me to pieces with no one to rescue me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord my God, if I have done this
    and there is guilt on my hands—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if I have repaid my ally with evil
    or without cause have robbed my foe—
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let the assembled peoples gather around you,
    while you sit enthroned over them on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the Lord judge the peoples.
Vindicate me, Lord, according to my righteousness,
    according to my integrity, O Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bring to an end the violence of the wicked
    and make the righteous secure—
you, the righteous God
    who probes minds and hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My shield is God Most High,
    who saves the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is a righteous judge,
    a God who displays his wrath every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He has prepared his deadly weapons;
    he makes ready his flaming arrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is pregnant with evil
    conceives trouble and gives birth to disillusionment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever digs a hole and scoops it out
    falls into the pit they have made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The trouble they cause recoils on them;
    their violence comes down on their own heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks to the Lord because of his righteousness;
    I will sing the praises of the name of the Lord Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, our Lord,
    how majestic is your name in all the earth!
You have set your glory
    in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through the praise of children and infants
    you have established a stronghold against your enemies,
    to silence the foe and the avenger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I consider your heavens,
    the work of your fingers,
the moon and the stars,
    which you have set in place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
what is mankind that you are mindful of them,
    human beings that you care for them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made them a little lower than the angels
    and crowned them with glory and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You made them rulers over the works of your hands;
    you put everything under their feet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all flocks and herds,
    and the animals of the wild,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the birds in the sky,
    and the fish in the sea,
    all that swim the paths of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, our Lord,
    how majestic is your name in all the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks to you, Lord, with all my heart;
    I will tell of all your wonderful deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will be glad and rejoice in you;
    I will sing the praises of your name, O Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My enemies turn back;
    they stumble and perish before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have upheld my right and my cause,
    sitting enthroned as the righteous judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the wicked;
    you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord reigns forever;
    he has established his throne for judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rules the world in righteousness
    and judges the peoples with equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is a refuge for the oppressed,
    a stronghold in times of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who know your name trust in you,
    for you, Lord, have never forsaken those who seek you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing the praises of the Lord, enthroned in Zion;
    proclaim among the nations what he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he who avenges blood remembers;
    he does not ignore the cries of the afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, see how my enemies persecute me!
    Have mercy and lift me up from the gates of death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that I may declare your praises
    in the gates of Daughter Zion,
    and there rejoice in your salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations have fallen into the pit they have dug;
    their feet are caught in the net they have hidden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is known by his acts of justice;
    the wicked are ensnared by the work of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked go down to the realm of the dead,
    all the nations that forget God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God will never forget the needy;
    the hope of the afflicted will never perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, Lord, do not let mortals triumph;
    let the nations be judged in your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strike them with terror, Lord;
    let the nations know they are only mortal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, Lord, do you stand far off?
    Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his arrogance the wicked man hunts down the weak,
    who are caught in the schemes he devises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He boasts about the cravings of his heart;
    he blesses the greedy and reviles the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his pride the wicked man does not seek him;
    in all his thoughts there is no room for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He says to himself, “Nothing will ever shake me.”
    He swears, “No one will ever do me harm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His mouth is full of lies and threats;
    trouble and evil are under his tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
His victims are crushed, they collapse;
    they fall under his strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He says to himself, “God will never notice;
    he covers his face and never sees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, Lord! Lift up your hand, O God.
    Do not forget the helpless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why does the wicked man revile God?
    Why does he say to himself,
    “He won’t call me to account”?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is King for ever and ever;
    the nations will perish from his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, Lord, hear the desire of the afflicted;
    you encourage them, and you listen to their cry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
defending the fatherless and the oppressed,
    so that mere earthly mortals
    will never again strike terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the Lord I take refuge.
    How then can you say to me:
    “Flee like a bird to your mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For look, the wicked bend their bows;
    they set their arrows against the strings
to shoot from the shadows
    at the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the foundations are being destroyed,
    what can the righteous do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord examines the righteous,
    but the wicked, those who love violence,
    he hates with a passion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Help, Lord, for no one is faithful anymore;
    those who are loyal have vanished from the human race.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord silence all flattering lips
    and every boastful tongue—
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Because the poor are plundered and the needy groan,
    I will now arise,” says the Lord.
    “I will protect them from those who malign them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the words of the Lord are flawless,
    like silver purified in a crucible,
    like gold refined seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, Lord, will keep the needy safe
    and will protect us forever from the wicked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who freely strut about
    when what is vile is honored by the human race.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, Lord? Will you forget me forever?
    How long will you hide your face from me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long must I wrestle with my thoughts
    and day after day have sorrow in my heart?
    How long will my enemy triumph over me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look on me and answer, Lord my God.
    Give light to my eyes, or I will sleep in death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and my enemy will say, “I have overcome him,”
    and my foes will rejoice when I fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I trust in your unfailing love;
    my heart rejoices in your salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing the Lord’s praise,
    for he has been good to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fool says in his heart,
    “There is no God.”
They are corrupt, their deeds are vile;
    there is no one who does good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord looks down from heaven
    on all mankind
to see if there are any who understand,
    any who seek God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But there they are, overwhelmed with dread,
    for God is present in the company of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You evildoers frustrate the plans of the poor,
    but the Lord is their refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion!
    When the Lord restores his people,
    let Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, who may dwell in your sacred tent?
    Who may live on your holy mountain?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
who lends money to the poor without interest;
    who does not accept a bribe against the innocent.
Whoever does these things
    will never be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep me safe, my God,
    for in you I take refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say to the Lord, “You are my Lord;
    apart from you I have no good thing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say of the holy people who are in the land,
    “They are the noble ones in whom is all my delight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who run after other gods will suffer more and more.
    I will not pour out libations of blood to such gods
    or take up their names on my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you alone are my portion and my cup;
    you make my lot secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places;
    surely I have a delightful inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise the Lord, who counsels me;
    even at night my heart instructs me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I keep my eyes always on the Lord.
    With him at my right hand, I will not be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices;
    my body also will rest secure,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because you will not abandon me to the realm of the dead,
    nor will you let your faithful one see decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear me, Lord, my plea is just;
    listen to my cry.
Hear my prayer—
    it does not rise from deceitful lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my vindication come from you;
    may your eyes see what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though you probe my heart,
    though you examine me at night and test me,
you will find that I have planned no evil;
    my mouth has not transgressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though people tried to bribe me,
    I have kept myself from the ways of the violent
    through what your lips have commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My steps have held to your paths;
    my feet have not stumbled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call on you, my God, for you will answer me;
    turn your ear to me and hear my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show me the wonders of your great love,
    you who save by your right hand
    those who take refuge in you from their foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep me as the apple of your eye;
    hide me in the shadow of your wings
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the wicked who are out to destroy me,
    from my mortal enemies who surround me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They close up their callous hearts,
    and their mouths speak with arrogance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have tracked me down, they now surround me,
    with eyes alert, to throw me to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like a lion hungry for prey,
    like a fierce lion crouching in cover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, Lord, confront them, bring them down;
    with your sword rescue me from the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By your hand save me from such people, Lord,
    from those of this world whose reward is in this life.
May what you have stored up for the wicked fill their bellies;
    may their children gorge themselves on it,
    and may there be leftovers for their little ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I will be vindicated and will see your face;
    when I awake, I will be satisfied with seeing your likeness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I love you, Lord, my strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I called to the Lord, who is worthy of praise,
    and I have been saved from my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cords of death entangled me;
    the torrents of destruction overwhelmed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cords of the grave coiled around me;
    the snares of death confronted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He parted the heavens and came down;
    dark clouds were under his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He mounted the cherubim and flew;
    he soared on the wings of the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made darkness his covering, his canopy around him—
    the dark rain clouds of the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of the brightness of his presence clouds advanced,
    with hailstones and bolts of lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord thundered from heaven;
    the voice of the Most High resounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shot his arrows and scattered the enemy,
    with great bolts of lightning he routed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The valleys of the sea were exposed
    and the foundations of the earth laid bare
at your rebuke, Lord,
    at the blast of breath from your nostrils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He reached down from on high and took hold of me;
    he drew me out of deep waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rescued me from my powerful enemy,
    from my foes, who were too strong for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They confronted me in the day of my disaster,
    but the Lord was my support.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought me out into a spacious place;
    he rescued me because he delighted in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has dealt with me according to my righteousness;
    according to the cleanness of my hands he has rewarded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have kept the ways of the Lord;
    I am not guilty of turning from my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All his laws are before me;
    I have not turned away from his decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have been blameless before him
    and have kept myself from sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has rewarded me according to my righteousness,
    according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the faithful you show yourself faithful,
    to the blameless you show yourself blameless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to the pure you show yourself pure,
    but to the devious you show yourself shrewd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You save the humble
    but bring low those whose eyes are haughty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, Lord, keep my lamp burning;
    my God turns my darkness into light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With your help I can advance against a troop;
    with my God I can scale a wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For who is God besides the Lord?
    And who is the Rock except our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is God who arms me with strength
    and keeps my way secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes my feet like the feet of a deer;
    he causes me to stand on the heights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He trains my hands for battle;
    my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You provide a broad path for my feet,
    so that my ankles do not give way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I pursued my enemies and overtook them;
    I did not turn back till they were destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I crushed them so that they could not rise;
    they fell beneath my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You armed me with strength for battle;
    you humbled my adversaries before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You made my enemies turn their backs in flight,
    and I destroyed my foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They cried for help, but there was no one to save them—
    to the Lord, but he did not answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I beat them as fine as windblown dust;
    I trampled them like mud in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
foreigners cower before me;
    as soon as they hear of me, they obey me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They all lose heart;
    they come trembling from their strongholds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord lives! Praise be to my Rock!
    Exalted be God my Savior!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the God who avenges me,
    who subdues nations under me,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will praise you, Lord, among the nations;
    I will sing the praises of your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens declare the glory of God;
    the skies proclaim the work of his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Day after day they pour forth speech;
    night after night they reveal knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have no speech, they use no words;
    no sound is heard from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet their voice goes out into all the earth,
    their words to the ends of the world.
In the heavens God has pitched a tent for the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is like a bridegroom coming out of his chamber,
    like a champion rejoicing to run his course.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The law of the Lord is perfect,
    refreshing the soul.
The statutes of the Lord are trustworthy,
    making wise the simple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The precepts of the Lord are right,
    giving joy to the heart.
The commands of the Lord are radiant,
    giving light to the eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is pure,
    enduring forever.
The decrees of the Lord are firm,
    and all of them are righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are more precious than gold,
    than much pure gold;
they are sweeter than honey,
    than honey from the honeycomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By them your servant is warned;
    in keeping them there is great reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But who can discern their own errors?
    Forgive my hidden faults.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep your servant also from willful sins;
    may they not rule over me.
Then I will be blameless,
    innocent of great transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May these words of my mouth and this meditation of my heart
    be pleasing in your sight,
    Lord, my Rock and my Redeemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord answer you when you are in distress;
    may the name of the God of Jacob protect you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he send you help from the sanctuary
    and grant you support from Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he remember all your sacrifices
    and accept your burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he give you the desire of your heart
    and make all your plans succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May we shout for joy over your victory
    and lift up our banners in the name of our God.
May the Lord grant all your requests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now this I know:
    The Lord gives victory to his anointed.
He answers him from his heavenly sanctuary
    with the victorious power of his right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some trust in chariots and some in horses,
    but we trust in the name of the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are brought to their knees and fall,
    but we rise up and stand firm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, give victory to the king!
    Answer us when we call!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king rejoices in your strength, Lord.
    How great is his joy in the victories you give!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have granted him his heart’s desire
    and have not withheld the request of his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You came to greet him with rich blessings
    and placed a crown of pure gold on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked you for life, and you gave it to him—
    length of days, for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through the victories you gave, his glory is great;
    you have bestowed on him splendor and majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely you have granted him unending blessings
    and made him glad with the joy of your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your hand will lay hold on all your enemies;
    your right hand will seize your foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you appear for battle,
    you will burn them up as in a blazing furnace.
The Lord will swallow them up in his wrath,
    and his fire will consume them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will destroy their descendants from the earth,
    their posterity from mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though they plot evil against you
    and devise wicked schemes, they cannot succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will make them turn their backs
    when you aim at them with drawn bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted in your strength, Lord;
    we will sing and praise your might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?
    Why are you so far from saving me,
    so far from my cries of anguish?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God, I cry out by day, but you do not answer,
    by night, but I find no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you are enthroned as the Holy One;
    you are the one Israel praises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In you our ancestors put their trust;
    they trusted and you delivered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To you they cried out and were saved;
    in you they trusted and were not put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am a worm and not a man,
    scorned by everyone, despised by the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who see me mock me;
    they hurl insults, shaking their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He trusts in the Lord,” they say,
    “let the Lord rescue him.
Let him deliver him,
    since he delights in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you brought me out of the womb;
    you made me trust in you, even at my mother’s breast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From birth I was cast on you;
    from my mother’s womb you have been my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be far from me,
    for trouble is near
    and there is no one to help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many bulls surround me;
    strong bulls of Bashan encircle me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Roaring lions that tear their prey
    open their mouths wide against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am poured out like water,
    and all my bones are out of joint.
My heart has turned to wax;
    it has melted within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All my bones are on display;
    people stare and gloat over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They divide my clothes among them
    and cast lots for my garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, Lord, do not be far from me.
    You are my strength; come quickly to help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from the sword,
    my precious life from the power of the dogs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue me from the mouth of the lions;
    save me from the horns of the wild oxen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will declare your name to my people;
    in the assembly I will praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who fear the Lord, praise him!
    All you descendants of Jacob, honor him!
    Revere him, all you descendants of Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he has not despised or scorned
    the suffering of the afflicted one;
he has not hidden his face from him
    but has listened to his cry for help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From you comes the theme of my praise in the great assembly;
    before those who fear you I will fulfill my vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All the ends of the earth
    will remember and turn to the Lord,
and all the families of the nations
    will bow down before him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for dominion belongs to the Lord
    and he rules over the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Posterity will serve him;
    future generations will be told about the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will proclaim his righteousness,
    declaring to a people yet unborn:
    He has done it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes me lie down in green pastures,
he leads me beside quiet waters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he refreshes my soul.
He guides me along the right paths
    for his name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even though I walk
    through the darkest valley,
I will fear no evil,
    for you are with me;
your rod and your staff,
    they comfort me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You prepare a table before me
    in the presence of my enemies.
You anoint my head with oil;
    my cup overflows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely your goodness and love will follow me
    all the days of my life,
and I will dwell in the house of the Lord
    forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth is the Lord’s, and everything in it,
    the world, and all who live in it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he founded it on the seas
    and established it on the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who may ascend the mountain of the Lord?
    Who may stand in his holy place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who has clean hands and a pure heart,
    who does not trust in an idol
    or swear by a false god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will receive blessing from the Lord
    and vindication from God their Savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Such is the generation of those who seek him,
    who seek your face, God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who is this King of glory?
    The Lord strong and mighty,
    the Lord mighty in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who is he, this King of glory?
    The Lord Almighty—
    he is the King of glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In you, Lord my God,
    I put my trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
No one who hopes in you
    will ever be put to shame,
but shame will come on those
    who are treacherous without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show me your ways, Lord,
    teach me your paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, Lord, your great mercy and love,
    for they are from of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not remember the sins of my youth
    and my rebellious ways;
according to your love remember me,
    for you, Lord, are good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good and upright is the Lord;
    therefore he instructs sinners in his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He guides the humble in what is right
    and teaches them his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the ways of the Lord are loving and faithful
    toward those who keep the demands of his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of your name, Lord,
    forgive my iniquity, though it is great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who, then, are those who fear the Lord?
    He will instruct them in the ways they should choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will spend their days in prosperity,
    and their descendants will inherit the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord confides in those who fear him;
    he makes his covenant known to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes are ever on the Lord,
    for only he will release my feet from the snare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
    for I am lonely and afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Relieve the troubles of my heart
    and free me from my anguish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look on my affliction and my distress
    and take away all my sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See how numerous are my enemies
    and how fiercely they hate me!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May integrity and uprightness protect me,
    because my hope, Lord, is in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver Israel, O God,
    from all their troubles!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Vindicate me, Lord,
    for I have led a blameless life;
I have trusted in the Lord
    and have not faltered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Test me, Lord, and try me,
    examine my heart and my mind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for I have always been mindful of your unfailing love
    and have lived in reliance on your faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I do not sit with the deceitful,
    nor do I associate with hypocrites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I abhor the assembly of evildoers
    and refuse to sit with the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I wash my hands in innocence,
    and go about your altar, Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
proclaiming aloud your praise
    and telling of all your wonderful deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, I love the house where you live,
    the place where your glory dwells.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not take away my soul along with sinners,
    my life with those who are bloodthirsty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in whose hands are wicked schemes,
    whose right hands are full of bribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lead a blameless life;
    deliver me and be merciful to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My feet stand on level ground;
    in the great congregation I will praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is my light and my salvation—
    whom shall I fear?
The Lord is the stronghold of my life—
    of whom shall I be afraid?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked advance against me
    to devour me,
it is my enemies and my foes
    who will stumble and fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though an army besiege me,
    my heart will not fear;
though war break out against me,
    even then I will be confident.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One thing I ask from the Lord,
    this only do I seek:
that I may dwell in the house of the Lord
    all the days of my life,
to gaze on the beauty of the Lord
    and to seek him in his temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For in the day of trouble
    he will keep me safe in his dwelling;
he will hide me in the shelter of his sacred tent
    and set me high upon a rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my voice when I call, Lord;
    be merciful to me and answer me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart says of you, “Seek his face!”
    Your face, Lord, I will seek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not hide your face from me,
    do not turn your servant away in anger;
    you have been my helper.
Do not reject me or forsake me,
    God my Savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though my father and mother forsake me,
    the Lord will receive me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I remain confident of this:
    I will see the goodness of the Lord
    in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
To you, Lord, I call;
    you are my Rock,
    do not turn a deaf ear to me.
For if you remain silent,
    I will be like those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my cry for mercy
    as I call to you for help,
as I lift up my hands
    toward your Most Holy Place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not drag me away with the wicked,
    with those who do evil,
who speak cordially with their neighbors
    but harbor malice in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Repay them for their deeds
    and for their evil work;
repay them for what their hands have done
    and bring back on them what they deserve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they have no regard for the deeds of the Lord
    and what his hands have done,
he will tear them down
    and never build them up again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to the Lord,
    for he has heard my cry for mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is my strength and my shield;
    my heart trusts in him, and he helps me.
My heart leaps for joy,
    and with my song I praise him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is the strength of his people,
    a fortress of salvation for his anointed one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save your people and bless your inheritance;
    be their shepherd and carry them forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord, you heavenly beings,
    ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory due his name;
    worship the Lord in the splendor of his holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord is powerful;
    the voice of the Lord is majestic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars;
    the Lord breaks in pieces the cedars of Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes Lebanon leap like a calf,
    Sirion like a young wild ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord strikes
    with flashes of lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord shakes the desert;
    the Lord shakes the Desert of Kadesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord twists the oaks
    and strips the forests bare.
And in his temple all cry, “Glory!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord sits enthroned over the flood;
    the Lord is enthroned as King forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord gives strength to his people;
    the Lord blesses his people with peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will exalt you, Lord,
    for you lifted me out of the depths
    and did not let my enemies gloat over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord my God, I called to you for help,
    and you healed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, Lord, brought me up from the realm of the dead;
    you spared me from going down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing the praises of the Lord, you his faithful people;
    praise his holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For his anger lasts only a moment,
    but his favor lasts a lifetime;
weeping may stay for the night,
    but rejoicing comes in the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I felt secure, I said,
    “I will never be shaken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, when you favored me,
    you made my royal mountain stand firm;
but when you hid your face,
    I was dismayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To you, Lord, I called;
    to the Lord I cried for mercy:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What is gained if I am silenced,
    if I go down to the pit?
Will the dust praise you?
    Will it proclaim your faithfulness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, Lord, and be merciful to me;
    Lord, be my help.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You turned my wailing into dancing;
    you removed my sackcloth and clothed me with joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that my heart may sing your praises and not be silent.
    Lord my God, I will praise you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Turn your ear to me,
    come quickly to my rescue;
be my rock of refuge,
    a strong fortress to save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since you are my rock and my fortress,
    for the sake of your name lead and guide me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep me free from the trap that is set for me,
    for you are my refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Into your hands I commit my spirit;
    deliver me, Lord, my faithful God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate those who cling to worthless idols;
    as for me, I trust in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will be glad and rejoice in your love,
    for you saw my affliction
    and knew the anguish of my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have not given me into the hands of the enemy
    but have set my feet in a spacious place.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My life is consumed by anguish
    and my years by groaning;
my strength fails because of my affliction,
    and my bones grow weak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of all my enemies,
    I am the utter contempt of my neighbors
and an object of dread to my closest friends—
    those who see me on the street flee from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am forgotten as though I were dead;
    I have become like broken pottery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I hear many whispering,
    “Terror on every side!”
They conspire against me
    and plot to take my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I trust in you, Lord;
    I say, “You are my God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let your face shine on your servant;
    save me in your unfailing love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me not be put to shame, Lord,
    for I have cried out to you;
but let the wicked be put to shame
    and be silent in the realm of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let their lying lips be silenced,
    for with pride and contempt
    they speak arrogantly against the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How abundant are the good things
    that you have stored up for those who fear you,
that you bestow in the sight of all,
    on those who take refuge in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the shelter of your presence you hide them
    from all human intrigues;
you keep them safe in your dwelling
    from accusing tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to the Lord,
    for he showed me the wonders of his love
    when I was in a city under siege.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In my alarm I said,
    “I am cut off from your sight!”
Yet you heard my cry for mercy
    when I called to you for help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Love the Lord, all his faithful people!
    The Lord preserves those who are true to him,
    but the proud he pays back in full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be strong and take heart,
    all you who hope in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the one
    whose transgressions are forgiven,
    whose sins are covered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the one
    whose sin the Lord does not count against them
    and in whose spirit is no deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I kept silent,
    my bones wasted away
    through my groaning all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For day and night
    your hand was heavy on me;
my strength was sapped
    as in the heat of summer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I acknowledged my sin to you
    and did not cover up my iniquity.
I said, “I will confess
    my transgressions to the Lord.”
And you forgave
    the guilt of my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore let all the faithful pray to you
    while you may be found;
surely the rising of the mighty waters
    will not reach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go;
    I will counsel you with my loving eye on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be like the horse or the mule,
    which have no understanding
but must be controlled by bit and bridle
    or they will not come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are the woes of the wicked,
    but the Lord’s unfailing love
    surrounds the one who trusts in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice in the Lord and be glad, you righteous;
    sing, all you who are upright in heart!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing joyfully to the Lord, you righteous;
    it is fitting for the upright to praise him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord with the harp;
    make music to him on the ten-stringed lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to him a new song;
    play skillfully, and shout for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the word of the Lord is right and true;
    he is faithful in all he does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord loves righteousness and justice;
    the earth is full of his unfailing love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the word of the Lord the heavens were made,
    their starry host by the breath of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gathers the waters of the sea into jars;
    he puts the deep into storehouses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all the earth fear the Lord;
    let all the people of the world revere him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he spoke, and it came to be;
    he commanded, and it stood firm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord foils the plans of the nations;
    he thwarts the purposes of the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the plans of the Lord stand firm forever,
    the purposes of his heart through all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord,
    the people he chose for his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From heaven the Lord looks down
    and sees all mankind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from his dwelling place he watches
    all who live on earth—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he who forms the hearts of all,
    who considers everything they do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No king is saved by the size of his army;
    no warrior escapes by his great strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A horse is a vain hope for deliverance;
    despite all its great strength it cannot save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the eyes of the Lord are on those who fear him,
    on those whose hope is in his unfailing love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to deliver them from death
    and keep them alive in famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We wait in hope for the Lord;
    he is our help and our shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In him our hearts rejoice,
    for we trust in his holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May your unfailing love be with us, Lord,
    even as we put our hope in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will extol the Lord at all times;
    his praise will always be on my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will glory in the Lord;
    let the afflicted hear and rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glorify the Lord with me;
    let us exalt his name together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I sought the Lord, and he answered me;
    he delivered me from all my fears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who look to him are radiant;
    their faces are never covered with shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This poor man called, and the Lord heard him;
    he saved him out of all his troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear him,
    and he delivers them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Taste and see that the Lord is good;
    blessed is the one who takes refuge in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fear the Lord, you his holy people,
    for those who fear him lack nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lions may grow weak and hungry,
    but those who seek the Lord lack no good thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, my children, listen to me;
    I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever of you loves life
    and desires to see many good days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
keep your tongue from evil
    and your lips from telling lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn from evil and do good;
    seek peace and pursue it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord are on the righteous,
    and his ears are attentive to their cry;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but the face of the Lord is against those who do evil,
    to blot out their name from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears them;
    he delivers them from all their troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is close to the brokenhearted
    and saves those who are crushed in spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous person may have many troubles,
    but the Lord delivers him from them all;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he protects all his bones,
    not one of them will be broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evil will slay the wicked;
    the foes of the righteous will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will rescue his servants;
    no one who takes refuge in him will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Contend, Lord, with those who contend with me;
    fight against those who fight against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take up shield and armor;
    arise and come to my aid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Brandish spear and javelin
    against those who pursue me.
Say to me,
    “I am your salvation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who seek my life
    be disgraced and put to shame;
may those who plot my ruin
    be turned back in dismay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they be like chaff before the wind,
    with the angel of the Lord driving them away;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
may their path be dark and slippery,
    with the angel of the Lord pursuing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since they hid their net for me without cause
    and without cause dug a pit for me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
may ruin overtake them by surprise—
    may the net they hid entangle them,
    may they fall into the pit, to their ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then my soul will rejoice in the Lord
    and delight in his salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My whole being will exclaim,
    “Who is like you, Lord?
You rescue the poor from those too strong for them,
    the poor and needy from those who rob them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ruthless witnesses come forward;
    they question me on things I know nothing about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They repay me evil for good
    and leave me like one bereaved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet when they were ill, I put on sackcloth
    and humbled myself with fasting.
When my prayers returned to me unanswered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I went about mourning
    as though for my friend or brother.
I bowed my head in grief
    as though weeping for my mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Like the ungodly they maliciously mocked;
    they gnashed their teeth at me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, Lord, will you look on?
    Rescue me from their ravages,
    my precious life from these lions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give you thanks in the great assembly;
    among the throngs I will praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let those gloat over me
    who are my enemies without cause;
do not let those who hate me without reason
    maliciously wink the eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not speak peaceably,
    but devise false accusations
    against those who live quietly in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sneer at me and say, “Aha! Aha!
    With our own eyes we have seen it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you have seen this; do not be silent.
    Do not be far from me, Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, and rise to my defense!
    Contend for me, my God and Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Vindicate me in your righteousness, Lord my God;
    do not let them gloat over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let them think, “Aha, just what we wanted!”
    or say, “We have swallowed him up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May all who gloat over my distress
    be put to shame and confusion;
may all who exalt themselves over me
    be clothed with shame and disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who delight in my vindication
    shout for joy and gladness;
may they always say, “The Lord be exalted,
    who delights in the well-being of his servant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tongue will proclaim your righteousness,
    your praises all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have a message from God in my heart
    concerning the sinfulness of the wicked:
There is no fear of God
    before their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In their own eyes they flatter themselves
    too much to detect or hate their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of their mouths are wicked and deceitful;
    they fail to act wisely or do good.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your love, Lord, reaches to the heavens,
    your faithfulness to the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your righteousness is like the highest mountains,
    your justice like the great deep.
    You, Lord, preserve both people and animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How priceless is your unfailing love, O God!
    People take refuge in the shadow of your wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They feast on the abundance of your house;
    you give them drink from your river of delights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For with you is the fountain of life;
    in your light we see light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Continue your love to those who know you,
    your righteousness to the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the foot of the proud not come against me,
    nor the hand of the wicked drive me away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See how the evildoers lie fallen—
    thrown down, not able to rise!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not fret because of those who are evil
    or be envious of those who do wrong;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for like the grass they will soon wither,
    like green plants they will soon die away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust in the Lord and do good;
    dwell in the land and enjoy safe pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take delight in the Lord,
    and he will give you the desires of your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Commit your way to the Lord;
    trust in him and he will do this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will make your righteous reward shine like the dawn,
    your vindication like the noonday sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be still before the Lord
    and wait patiently for him;
do not fret when people succeed in their ways,
    when they carry out their wicked schemes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Refrain from anger and turn from wrath;
    do not fret—it leads only to evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For those who are evil will be destroyed,
    but those who hope in the Lord will inherit the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A little while, and the wicked will be no more;
    though you look for them, they will not be found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the meek will inherit the land
    and enjoy peace and prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked plot against the righteous
    and gnash their teeth at them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but the Lord laughs at the wicked,
    for he knows their day is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked draw the sword
    and bend the bow
to bring down the poor and needy,
    to slay those whose ways are upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But their swords will pierce their own hearts,
    and their bows will be broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better the little that the righteous have
    than the wealth of many wicked;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the power of the wicked will be broken,
    but the Lord upholds the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blameless spend their days under the Lord’s care,
    and their inheritance will endure forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In times of disaster they will not wither;
    in days of famine they will enjoy plenty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the wicked will perish:
    Though the Lord’s enemies are like the flowers of the field,
    they will be consumed, they will go up in smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked borrow and do not repay,
    but the righteous give generously;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those the Lord blesses will inherit the land,
    but those he curses will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord makes firm the steps
    of the one who delights in him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though he may stumble, he will not fall,
    for the Lord upholds him with his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was young and now I am old,
    yet I have never seen the righteous forsaken
    or their children begging bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are always generous and lend freely;
    their children will be a blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn from evil and do good;
    then you will dwell in the land forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord loves the just
    and will not forsake his faithful ones.
Wrongdoers will be completely destroyed;
    the offspring of the wicked will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will inherit the land
    and dwell in it forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouths of the righteous utter wisdom,
    and their tongues speak what is just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The law of their God is in their hearts;
    their feet do not slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked lie in wait for the righteous,
    intent on putting them to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but the Lord will not leave them in the power of the wicked
    or let them be condemned when brought to trial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hope in the Lord
    and keep his way.
He will exalt you to inherit the land;
    when the wicked are destroyed, you will see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen a wicked and ruthless man
    flourishing like a luxuriant native tree,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but he soon passed away and was no more;
    though I looked for him, he could not be found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider the blameless, observe the upright;
    a future awaits those who seek peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But all sinners will be destroyed;
    there will be no future for the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The salvation of the righteous comes from the Lord;
    he is their stronghold in time of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger
    or discipline me in your wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your arrows have pierced me,
    and your hand has come down on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of your wrath there is no health in my body;
    there is no soundness in my bones because of my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My guilt has overwhelmed me
    like a burden too heavy to bear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My wounds fester and are loathsome
    because of my sinful folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am bowed down and brought very low;
    all day long I go about mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My back is filled with searing pain;
    there is no health in my body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am feeble and utterly crushed;
    I groan in anguish of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All my longings lie open before you, Lord;
    my sighing is not hidden from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart pounds, my strength fails me;
    even the light has gone from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My friends and companions avoid me because of my wounds;
    my neighbors stay far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I am like the deaf, who cannot hear,
    like the mute, who cannot speak;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have become like one who does not hear,
    whose mouth can offer no reply.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, I wait for you;
    you will answer, Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I said, “Do not let them gloat
    or exalt themselves over me when my feet slip.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am about to fall,
    and my pain is ever with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I confess my iniquity;
    I am troubled by my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many have become my enemies without cause;
    those who hate me without reason are numerous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who repay my good with evil
    lodge accusations against me,
    though I seek only to do what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, do not forsake me;
    do not be far from me, my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come quickly to help me,
    my Lord and my Savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “I will watch my ways
    and keep my tongue from sin;
I will put a muzzle on my mouth
    while in the presence of the wicked.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You have made my days a mere handbreadth;
    the span of my years is as nothing before you.
Everyone is but a breath,
    even those who seem secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“But now, Lord, what do I look for?
    My hope is in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save me from all my transgressions;
    do not make me the scorn of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was silent; I would not open my mouth,
    for you are the one who has done this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove your scourge from me;
    I am overcome by the blow of your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you rebuke and discipline anyone for their sin,
    you consume their wealth like a moth—
    surely everyone is but a breath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear my prayer, Lord,
    listen to my cry for help;
    do not be deaf to my weeping.
I dwell with you as a foreigner,
    a stranger, as all my ancestors were.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look away from me, that I may enjoy life again
    before I depart and am no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I waited patiently for the Lord;
    he turned to me and heard my cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He lifted me out of the slimy pit,
    out of the mud and mire;
he set my feet on a rock
    and gave me a firm place to stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He put a new song in my mouth,
    a hymn of praise to our God.
Many will see and fear the Lord
    and put their trust in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the one
    who trusts in the Lord,
who does not look to the proud,
    to those who turn aside to false gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many, Lord my God,
    are the wonders you have done,
    the things you planned for us.
None can compare with you;
    were I to speak and tell of your deeds,
    they would be too many to declare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sacrifice and offering you did not desire—
    but my ears you have opened—
    burnt offerings and sin offerings you did not require.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “Here I am, I have come—
    it is written about me in the scroll.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I desire to do your will, my God;
    your law is within my heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I do not hide your righteousness in my heart;
    I speak of your faithfulness and your saving help.
I do not conceal your love and your faithfulness
    from the great assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not withhold your mercy from me, Lord;
    may your love and faithfulness always protect me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For troubles without number surround me;
    my sins have overtaken me, and I cannot see.
They are more than the hairs of my head,
    and my heart fails within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be pleased to save me, Lord;
    come quickly, Lord, to help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May all who want to take my life
    be put to shame and confusion;
may all who desire my ruin
    be turned back in disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who say to me, “Aha! Aha!”
    be appalled at their own shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But may all who seek you
    rejoice and be glad in you;
may those who long for your saving help always say,
    “The Lord is great!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who have regard for the weak;
    the Lord delivers them in times of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord protects and preserves them—
    they are counted among the blessed in the land—
    he does not give them over to the desire of their foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord sustains them on their sickbed
    and restores them from their bed of illness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “Have mercy on me, Lord;
    heal me, for I have sinned against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My enemies say of me in malice,
    “When will he die and his name perish?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All my enemies whisper together against me;
    they imagine the worst for me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A vile disease has afflicted him;
    he will never get up from the place where he lies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even my close friend,
    someone I trusted,
one who shared my bread,
    has turned against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But may you have mercy on me, Lord;
    raise me up, that I may repay them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know that you are pleased with me,
    for my enemy does not triumph over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of my integrity you uphold me
    and set me in your presence forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting.
Amen and Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the deer pants for streams of water,
    so my soul pants for you, my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul thirsts for God, for the living God.
    When can I go and meet with God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tears have been my food
    day and night,
while people say to me all day long,
    “Where is your God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These things I remember
    as I pour out my soul:
how I used to go to the house of God
    under the protection of the Mighty One
with shouts of joy and praise
    among the festive throng.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, my soul, are you downcast?
    Why so disturbed within me?
Put your hope in God,
    for I will yet praise him,
    my Savior and my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Deep calls to deep
    in the roar of your waterfalls;
all your waves and breakers
    have swept over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By day the Lord directs his love,
    at night his song is with me—
    a prayer to the God of my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say to God my Rock,
    “Why have you forgotten me?
Why must I go about mourning,
    oppressed by the enemy?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My bones suffer mortal agony
    as my foes taunt me,
saying to me all day long,
    “Where is your God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, my soul, are you downcast?
    Why so disturbed within me?
Put your hope in God,
    for I will yet praise him,
    my Savior and my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Vindicate me, my God,
    and plead my cause
    against an unfaithful nation.
Rescue me from those who are
    deceitful and wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are God my stronghold.
    Why have you rejected me?
Why must I go about mourning,
    oppressed by the enemy?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will go to the altar of God,
    to God, my joy and my delight.
I will praise you with the lyre,
    O God, my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, my soul, are you downcast?
    Why so disturbed within me?
Put your hope in God,
    for I will yet praise him,
    my Savior and my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have heard it with our ears, O God;
    our ancestors have told us
what you did in their days,
    in days long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With your hand you drove out the nations
    and planted our ancestors;
you crushed the peoples
    and made our ancestors flourish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was not by their sword that they won the land,
    nor did their arm bring them victory;
it was your right hand, your arm,
    and the light of your face, for you loved them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my King and my God,
    who decrees victories for Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through you we push back our enemies;
    through your name we trample our foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I put no trust in my bow,
    my sword does not bring me victory;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but you give us victory over our enemies,
    you put our adversaries to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God we make our boast all day long,
    and we will praise your name forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now you have rejected and humbled us;
    you no longer go out with our armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You made us retreat before the enemy,
    and our adversaries have plundered us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You gave us up to be devoured like sheep
    and have scattered us among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You sold your people for a pittance,
    gaining nothing from their sale.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us a reproach to our neighbors,
    the scorn and derision of those around us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us a byword among the nations;
    the peoples shake their heads at us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I live in disgrace all day long,
    and my face is covered with shame
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
at the taunts of those who reproach and revile me,
    because of the enemy, who is bent on revenge.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Our hearts had not turned back;
    our feet had not strayed from your path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you crushed us and made us a haunt for jackals;
    you covered us over with deep darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If we had forgotten the name of our God
    or spread out our hands to a foreign god,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
would not God have discovered it,
    since he knows the secrets of the heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet for your sake we face death all day long;
    we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, Lord! Why do you sleep?
    Rouse yourself! Do not reject us forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you hide your face
    and forget our misery and oppression?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We are brought down to the dust;
    our bodies cling to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up and help us;
    rescue us because of your unfailing love.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You are the most excellent of men
    and your lips have been anointed with grace,
    since God has blessed you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gird your sword on your side, you mighty one;
    clothe yourself with splendor and majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let your sharp arrows pierce the hearts of the king’s enemies;
    let the nations fall beneath your feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your throne, O God, will last for ever and ever;
    a scepter of justice will be the scepter of your kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Daughters of kings are among your honored women;
    at your right hand is the royal bride in gold of Ophir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, daughter, and pay careful attention:
    Forget your people and your father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the king be enthralled by your beauty;
    honor him, for he is your lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The city of Tyre will come with a gift,
    people of wealth will seek your favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All glorious is the princess within her chamber;
    her gown is interwoven with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Led in with joy and gladness,
    they enter the palace of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your sons will take the place of your fathers;
