    you will make them princes throughout the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will perpetuate your memory through all generations;
    therefore the nations will praise you for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is our refuge and strength,
    an ever-present help in trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore we will not fear, though the earth give way
    and the mountains fall into the heart of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though its waters roar and foam
    and the mountains quake with their surging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God,
    the holy place where the Most High dwells.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is within her, she will not fall;
    God will help her at break of day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nations are in uproar, kingdoms fall;
    he lifts his voice, the earth melts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord Almighty is with us;
    the God of Jacob is our fortress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come and see what the Lord has done,
    the desolations he has brought on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes wars cease
    to the ends of the earth.
He breaks the bow and shatters the spear;
    he burns the shields with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord Almighty is with us;
    the God of Jacob is our fortress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clap your hands, all you nations;
    shout to God with cries of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord Most High is awesome,
    the great King over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He subdued nations under us,
    peoples under our feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He chose our inheritance for us,
    the pride of Jacob, whom he loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has ascended amid shouts of joy,
    the Lord amid the sounding of trumpets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing praises to God, sing praises;
    sing praises to our King, sing praises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God is the King of all the earth;
    sing to him a psalm of praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God reigns over the nations;
    God is seated on his holy throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nobles of the nations assemble
    as the people of the God of Abraham,
for the kings of the earth belong to God;
    he is greatly exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is the Lord, and most worthy of praise,
    in the city of our God, his holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beautiful in its loftiness,
    the joy of the whole earth,
like the heights of Zaphon is Mount Zion,
    the city of the Great King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is in her citadels;
    he has shown himself to be her fortress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the kings joined forces,
    when they advanced together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they saw her and were astounded;
    they fled in terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trembling seized them there,
    pain like that of a woman in labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You destroyed them like ships of Tarshish
    shattered by an east wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As we have heard,
    so we have seen
in the city of the Lord Almighty,
    in the city of our God:
God makes her secure
    forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Within your temple, O God,
    we meditate on your unfailing love.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Mount Zion rejoices,
    the villages of Judah are glad
    because of your judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Walk about Zion, go around her,
    count her towers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
consider well her ramparts,
    view her citadels,
that you may tell of them
    to the next generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this God is our God for ever and ever;
    he will be our guide even to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, all you peoples;
    listen, all who live in this world,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
both low and high,
    rich and poor alike:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will speak words of wisdom;
    the meditation of my heart will give you understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will turn my ear to a proverb;
    with the harp I will expound my riddle:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should I fear when evil days come,
    when wicked deceivers surround me—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those who trust in their wealth
    and boast of their great riches?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one can redeem the life of another
    or give to God a ransom for them—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the ransom for a life is costly,
    no payment is ever enough—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that they should live on forever
    and not see decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all can see that the wise die,
    that the foolish and the senseless also perish,
    leaving their wealth to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their tombs will remain their houses forever,
    their dwellings for endless generations,
    though they had named lands after themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People, despite their wealth, do not endure;
    they are like the beasts that perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the fate of those who trust in themselves,
    and of their followers, who approve their sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like sheep and are destined to die;
    death will be their shepherd
    (but the upright will prevail over them in the morning).
Their forms will decay in the grave,
    far from their princely mansions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God will redeem me from the realm of the dead;
    he will surely take me to himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be overawed when others grow rich,
    when the splendor of their houses increases;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for they will take nothing with them when they die,
    their splendor will not descend with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though while they live they count themselves blessed—
    and people praise you when you prosper—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they will join those who have gone before them,
    who will never again see the light of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People who have wealth but lack understanding
    are like the beasts that perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Mighty One, God, the Lord,
    speaks and summons the earth
    from the rising of the sun to where it sets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From Zion, perfect in beauty,
    God shines forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our God comes
    and will not be silent;
a fire devours before him,
    and around him a tempest rages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He summons the heavens above,
    and the earth, that he may judge his people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Gather to me this consecrated people,
    who made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the heavens proclaim his righteousness,
    for he is a God of justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I bring no charges against you concerning your sacrifices
    or concerning your burnt offerings, which are ever before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have no need of a bull from your stall
    or of goats from your pens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for every animal of the forest is mine,
    and the cattle on a thousand hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know every bird in the mountains,
    and the insects in the fields are mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I were hungry I would not tell you,
    for the world is mine, and all that is in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do I eat the flesh of bulls
    or drink the blood of goats?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Sacrifice thank offerings to God,
    fulfill your vows to the Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and call on me in the day of trouble;
    I will deliver you, and you will honor me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But to the wicked person, God says:
“What right have you to recite my laws
    or take my covenant on your lips?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You hate my instruction
    and cast my words behind you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you see a thief, you join with him;
    you throw in your lot with adulterers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You use your mouth for evil
    and harness your tongue to deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You sit and testify against your brother
    and slander your own mother’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you did these things and I kept silent,
    you thought I was exactly like you.
But I now arraign you
    and set my accusations before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Consider this, you who forget God,
    or I will tear you to pieces, with no one to rescue you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who sacrifice thank offerings honor me,
    and to the blameless I will show my salvation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy on me, O God,
    according to your unfailing love;
according to your great compassion
    blot out my transgressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wash away all my iniquity
    and cleanse me from my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I know my transgressions,
    and my sin is always before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against you, you only, have I sinned
    and done what is evil in your sight;
so you are right in your verdict
    and justified when you judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely I was sinful at birth,
    sinful from the time my mother conceived me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you desired faithfulness even in the womb;
    you taught me wisdom in that secret place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cleanse me with hyssop, and I will be clean;
    wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me hear joy and gladness;
    let the bones you have crushed rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide your face from my sins
    and blot out all my iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Create in me a pure heart, O God,
    and renew a steadfast spirit within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not cast me from your presence
    or take your Holy Spirit from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore to me the joy of your salvation
    and grant me a willing spirit, to sustain me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will teach transgressors your ways,
    so that sinners will turn back to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from the guilt of bloodshed, O God,
    you who are God my Savior,
    and my tongue will sing of your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open my lips, Lord,
    and my mouth will declare your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You do not delight in sacrifice, or I would bring it;
    you do not take pleasure in burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May it please you to prosper Zion,
    to build up the walls of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you boast of evil, you mighty hero?
    Why do you boast all day long,
    you who are a disgrace in the eyes of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You love evil rather than good,
    falsehood rather than speaking the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You love every harmful word,
    you deceitful tongue!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will see and fear;
    they will laugh at you, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Here now is the man
    who did not make God his stronghold
but trusted in his great wealth
    and grew strong by destroying others!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am like an olive tree
    flourishing in the house of God;
I trust in God’s unfailing love
    for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For what you have done I will always praise you
    in the presence of your faithful people.
And I will hope in your name,
    for your name is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fool says in his heart,
    “There is no God.”
They are corrupt, and their ways are vile;
    there is no one who does good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God looks down from heaven
    on all mankind
to see if there are any who understand,
    any who seek God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But there they are, overwhelmed with dread,
    where there was nothing to dread.
God scattered the bones of those who attacked you;
    you put them to shame, for God despised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion!
    When God restores his people,
    let Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save me, O God, by your name;
    vindicate me by your might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my prayer, O God;
    listen to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely God is my help;
    the Lord is the one who sustains me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let evil recoil on those who slander me;
    in your faithfulness destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sacrifice a freewill offering to you;
    I will praise your name, Lord, for it is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have delivered me from all my troubles,
    and my eyes have looked in triumph on my foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to my prayer, O God,
    do not ignore my plea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
hear me and answer me.
My thoughts trouble me and I am distraught
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of what my enemy is saying,
    because of the threats of the wicked;
for they bring down suffering on me
    and assail me in their anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is in anguish within me;
    the terrors of death have fallen on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fear and trembling have beset me;
    horror has overwhelmed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “Oh, that I had the wings of a dove!
    I would fly away and be at rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would flee far away
    and stay in the desert;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would hurry to my place of shelter,
    far from the tempest and storm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, confuse the wicked, confound their words,
    for I see violence and strife in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Day and night they prowl about on its walls;
    malice and abuse are within it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Destructive forces are at work in the city;
    threats and lies never leave its streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But it is you, a man like myself,
    my companion, my close friend,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with whom I once enjoyed sweet fellowship
    at the house of God,
as we walked about
    among the worshipers.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I call to God,
    and the Lord saves me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evening, morning and noon
    I cry out in distress,
    and he hears my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God, who is enthroned from of old,
    who does not change—
he will hear them and humble them,
    because they have no fear of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My companion attacks his friends;
    he violates his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His talk is smooth as butter,
    yet war is in his heart;
his words are more soothing than oil,
    yet they are drawn swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast your cares on the Lord
    and he will sustain you;
he will never let
    the righteous be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, God, will bring down the wicked
    into the pit of decay;
the bloodthirsty and deceitful
    will not live out half their days.
But as for me, I trust in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My adversaries pursue me all day long;
    in their pride many are attacking me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I am afraid, I put my trust in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God, whose word I praise—
in God I trust and am not afraid.
    What can mere mortals do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long they twist my words;
    all their schemes are for my ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They conspire, they lurk,
    they watch my steps,
    hoping to take my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of their wickedness do not let them escape;
    in your anger, God, bring the nations down.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then my enemies will turn back
    when I call for help.
    By this I will know that God is for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God, whose word I praise,
    in the Lord, whose word I praise—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in God I trust and am not afraid.
    What can man do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am under vows to you, my God;
    I will present my thank offerings to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have delivered me from death
    and my feet from stumbling,
that I may walk before God
    in the light of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy on me, my God, have mercy on me,
    for in you I take refuge.
I will take refuge in the shadow of your wings
    until the disaster has passed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry out to God Most High,
    to God, who vindicates me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sends from heaven and saves me,
    rebuking those who hotly pursue me—
    God sends forth his love and his faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am in the midst of lions;
    I am forced to dwell among ravenous beasts—
men whose teeth are spears and arrows,
    whose tongues are sharp swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens;
    let your glory be over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They spread a net for my feet—
    I was bowed down in distress.
They dug a pit in my path—
    but they have fallen into it themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, my soul!
    Awake, harp and lyre!
    I will awaken the dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise you, Lord, among the nations;
    I will sing of you among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is your love, reaching to the heavens;
    your faithfulness reaches to the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens;
    let your glory be over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you rulers indeed speak justly?
    Do you judge people with equity?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No, in your heart you devise injustice,
    and your hands mete out violence on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even from birth the wicked go astray;
    from the womb they are wayward, spreading lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their venom is like the venom of a snake,
    like that of a cobra that has stopped its ears,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that will not heed the tune of the charmer,
    however skillful the enchanter may be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Break the teeth in their mouths, O God;
    Lord, tear out the fangs of those lions!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them vanish like water that flows away;
    when they draw the bow, let their arrows fall short.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they be like a slug that melts away as it moves along,
    like a stillborn child that never sees the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before your pots can feel the heat of the thorns—
    whether they be green or dry—the wicked will be swept away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will be glad when they are avenged,
    when they dip their feet in the blood of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from my enemies, O God;
    be my fortress against those who are attacking me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from evildoers
    and save me from those who are after my blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See how they lie in wait for me!
    Fierce men conspire against me
    for no offense or sin of mine, Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have done no wrong, yet they are ready to attack me.
    Arise to help me; look on my plight!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, Lord God Almighty,
    you who are the God of Israel,
rouse yourself to punish all the nations;
    show no mercy to wicked traitors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They return at evening,
    snarling like dogs,
    and prowl about the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See what they spew from their mouths—
    the words from their lips are sharp as swords,
    and they think, “Who can hear us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you laugh at them, Lord;
    you scoff at all those nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my strength, I watch for you;
    you, God, are my fortress,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my God on whom I can rely.
God will go before me
    and will let me gloat over those who slander me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But do not kill them, Lord our shield,
    or my people will forget.
In your might uproot them
    and bring them down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sins of their mouths,
    for the words of their lips,
    let them be caught in their pride.
For the curses and lies they utter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
consume them in your wrath,
    consume them till they are no more.
Then it will be known to the ends of the earth
    that God rules over Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They return at evening,
    snarling like dogs,
    and prowl about the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They wander about for food
    and howl if not satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You have rejected us, God, and burst upon us;
    you have been angry—now restore us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have shaken the land and torn it open;
    mend its fractures, for it is quaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have shown your people desperate times;
    you have given us wine that makes us stagger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But for those who fear you, you have raised a banner
    to be unfurled against the bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save us and help us with your right hand,
    that those you love may be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has spoken from his sanctuary:
    “In triumph I will parcel out Shechem
    and measure off the Valley of Sukkoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who will bring me to the fortified city?
    Who will lead me to Edom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it not you, God, you who have now rejected us
    and no longer go out with our armies?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give us aid against the enemy,
    for human help is worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With God we will gain the victory,
    and he will trample down our enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my cry, O God;
    listen to my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For you have been my refuge,
    a strong tower against the foe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I long to dwell in your tent forever
    and take refuge in the shelter of your wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, God, have heard my vows;
    you have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Increase the days of the king’s life,
    his years for many generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he be enthroned in God’s presence forever;
    appoint your love and faithfulness to protect him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will ever sing in praise of your name
    and fulfill my vows day after day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly my soul finds rest in God;
    my salvation comes from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly he is my rock and my salvation;
    he is my fortress, I will never be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you assault me?
    Would all of you throw me down—
    this leaning wall, this tottering fence?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely they intend to topple me
    from my lofty place;
    they take delight in lies.
With their mouths they bless,
    but in their hearts they curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, my soul, find rest in God;
    my hope comes from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly he is my rock and my salvation;
    he is my fortress, I will not be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My salvation and my honor depend on God;
    he is my mighty rock, my refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the lowborn are but a breath,
    the highborn are but a lie.
If weighed on a balance, they are nothing;
    together they are only a breath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not trust in extortion
    or put vain hope in stolen goods;
though your riches increase,
    do not set your heart on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One thing God has spoken,
    two things I have heard:
“Power belongs to you, God,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You, God, are my God,
    earnestly I seek you;
I thirst for you,
    my whole being longs for you,
in a dry and parched land
    where there is no water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen you in the sanctuary
    and beheld your power and your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because your love is better than life,
    my lips will glorify you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise you as long as I live,
    and in your name I will lift up my hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will be fully satisfied as with the richest of foods;
    with singing lips my mouth will praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On my bed I remember you;
    I think of you through the watches of the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because you are my help,
    I sing in the shadow of your wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cling to you;
    your right hand upholds me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who want to kill me will be destroyed;
    they will go down to the depths of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be given over to the sword
    and become food for jackals.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear me, my God, as I voice my complaint;
    protect my life from the threat of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked,
    from the plots of evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sharpen their tongues like swords
    and aim cruel words like deadly arrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shoot from ambush at the innocent;
    they shoot suddenly, without fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They plot injustice and say,
    “We have devised a perfect plan!”
    Surely the human mind and heart are cunning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God will shoot them with his arrows;
    they will suddenly be struck down.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise awaits you, our God, in Zion;
    to you our vows will be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who answer prayer,
    to you all people will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When we were overwhelmed by sins,
    you forgave our transgressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those you choose
    and bring near to live in your courts!
We are filled with the good things of your house,
    of your holy temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You answer us with awesome and righteous deeds,
    God our Savior,
the hope of all the ends of the earth
    and of the farthest seas,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who formed the mountains by your power,
    having armed yourself with strength,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who stilled the roaring of the seas,
    the roaring of their waves,
    and the turmoil of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You care for the land and water it;
    you enrich it abundantly.
The streams of God are filled with water
    to provide the people with grain,
    for so you have ordained it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You drench its furrows and level its ridges;
    you soften it with showers and bless its crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You crown the year with your bounty,
    and your carts overflow with abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The grasslands of the wilderness overflow;
    the hills are clothed with gladness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Shout for joy to God, all the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing the glory of his name;
    make his praise glorious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to God, “How awesome are your deeds!
    So great is your power
    that your enemies cringe before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Come and see what God has done,
    his awesome deeds for mankind!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned the sea into dry land,
    they passed through the waters on foot—
    come, let us rejoice in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rules forever by his power,
    his eyes watch the nations—
    let not the rebellious rise up against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise our God, all peoples,
    let the sound of his praise be heard;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has preserved our lives
    and kept our feet from slipping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, God, tested us;
    you refined us like silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You brought us into prison
    and laid burdens on our backs.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will come to your temple with burnt offerings
    and fulfill my vows to you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
vows my lips promised and my mouth spoke
    when I was in trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Come and hear, all you who fear God;
    let me tell you what he has done for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried out to him with my mouth;
    his praise was on my tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I had cherished sin in my heart,
    the Lord would not have listened;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but God has surely listened
    and has heard my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to God,
    who has not rejected my prayer
    or withheld his love from me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God be gracious to us and bless us
    and make his face shine on us—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that your ways may be known on earth,
    your salvation among all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the peoples praise you, God;
    may all the peoples praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the nations be glad and sing for joy,
    for you rule the peoples with equity
    and guide the nations of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the peoples praise you, God;
    may all the peoples praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The land yields its harvest;
    God, our God, blesses us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God bless us still,
    so that all the ends of the earth will fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God arise, may his enemies be scattered;
    may his foes flee before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May you blow them away like smoke—
    as wax melts before the fire,
    may the wicked perish before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
A father to the fatherless, a defender of widows,
    is God in his holy dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When you, God, went out before your people,
    when you marched through the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the earth shook, the heavens poured down rain,
    before God, the One of Sinai,
    before God, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You gave abundant showers, O God;
    you refreshed your weary inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your people settled in it,
    and from your bounty, God, you provided for the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord announces the word,
    and the women who proclaim it are a mighty throng:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Kings and armies flee in haste;
    the women at home divide the plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even while you sleep among the sheep pens,
    the wings of my dove are sheathed with silver,
    its feathers with shining gold.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Almighty scattered the kings in the land,
    it was like snow fallen on Mount Zalmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mount Bashan, majestic mountain,
    Mount Bashan, rugged mountain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
why gaze in envy, you rugged mountain,
    at the mountain where God chooses to reign,
    where the Lord himself will dwell forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When you ascended on high,
    you took many captives;
    you received gifts from people,
even from the rebellious—
    that you, Lord God, might dwell there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to the Lord, to God our Savior,
    who daily bears our burdens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our God is a God who saves;
    from the Sovereign Lord comes escape from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely God will crush the heads of his enemies,
    the hairy crowns of those who go on in their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord says, “I will bring them from Bashan;
    I will bring them from the depths of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that your feet may wade in the blood of your foes,
    while the tongues of your dogs have their share.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your procession, God, has come into view,
    the procession of my God and King into the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In front are the singers, after them the musicians;
    with them are the young women playing the timbrels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise God in the great congregation;
    praise the Lord in the assembly of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is the little tribe of Benjamin, leading them,
    there the great throng of Judah’s princes,
    and there the princes of Zebulun and of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Summon your power, God;
    show us your strength, our God, as you have done before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of your temple at Jerusalem
    kings will bring you gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rebuke the beast among the reeds,
    the herd of bulls among the calves of the nations.
Humbled, may the beast bring bars of silver.
    Scatter the nations who delight in war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Envoys will come from Egypt;
    Cush will submit herself to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth,
    sing praise to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to him who rides across the highest heavens, the ancient heavens,
    who thunders with mighty voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Proclaim the power of God,
    whose majesty is over Israel,
    whose power is in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Save me, O God,
    for the waters have come up to my neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I sink in the miry depths,
    where there is no foothold.
I have come into the deep waters;
    the floods engulf me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am worn out calling for help;
    my throat is parched.
My eyes fail,
    looking for my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who hate me without reason
    outnumber the hairs of my head;
many are my enemies without cause,
    those who seek to destroy me.
I am forced to restore
    what I did not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, God, know my folly;
    my guilt is not hidden from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, the Lord Almighty,
    may those who hope in you
    not be disgraced because of me;
God of Israel,
    may those who seek you
    not be put to shame because of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I endure scorn for your sake,
    and shame covers my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am a foreigner to my own family,
    a stranger to my own mother’s children;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for zeal for your house consumes me,
    and the insults of those who insult you fall on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I weep and fast,
    I must endure scorn;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when I put on sackcloth,
    people make sport of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who sit at the gate mock me,
    and I am the song of the drunkards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I pray to you, Lord,
    in the time of your favor;
in your great love, O God,
    answer me with your sure salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue me from the mire,
    do not let me sink;
deliver me from those who hate me,
    from the deep waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let the floodwaters engulf me
    or the depths swallow me up
    or the pit close its mouth over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer me, Lord, out of the goodness of your love;
    in your great mercy turn to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not hide your face from your servant;
    answer me quickly, for I am in trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come near and rescue me;
    deliver me because of my foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You know how I am scorned, disgraced and shamed;
    all my enemies are before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Scorn has broken my heart
    and has left me helpless;
I looked for sympathy, but there was none,
    for comforters, but I found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They put gall in my food
    and gave me vinegar for my thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the table set before them become a snare;
    may it become retribution and a trap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May their eyes be darkened so they cannot see,
    and their backs be bent forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your wrath on them;
    let your fierce anger overtake them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May their place be deserted;
    let there be no one to dwell in their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they persecute those you wound
    and talk about the pain of those you hurt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Charge them with crime upon crime;
    do not let them share in your salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they be blotted out of the book of life
    and not be listed with the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, afflicted and in pain—
    may your salvation, God, protect me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise God’s name in song
    and glorify him with thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This will please the Lord more than an ox,
    more than a bull with its horns and hooves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor will see and be glad—
    you who seek God, may your hearts live!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord hears the needy
    and does not despise his captive people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let heaven and earth praise him,
    the seas and all that move in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the children of his servants will inherit it,
    and those who love his name will dwell there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hasten, O God, to save me;
    come quickly, Lord, to help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who want to take my life
    be put to shame and confusion;
may all who desire my ruin
    be turned back in disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who say to me, “Aha! Aha!”
    turn back because of their shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But may all who seek you
    rejoice and be glad in you;
may those who long for your saving help always say,
    “The Lord is great!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In you, Lord, I have taken refuge;
    let me never be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In your righteousness, rescue me and deliver me;
    turn your ear to me and save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be my rock of refuge,
    to which I can always go;
give the command to save me,
    for you are my rock and my fortress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me, my God, from the hand of the wicked,
    from the grasp of those who are evil and cruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have been my hope, Sovereign Lord,
    my confidence since my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I have become a sign to many;
    you are my strong refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth is filled with your praise,
    declaring your splendor all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not cast me away when I am old;
    do not forsake me when my strength is gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my enemies speak against me;
    those who wait to kill me conspire together.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be far from me, my God;
    come quickly, God, to help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I will always have hope;
    I will praise you more and more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will tell of your righteous deeds,
    of your saving acts all day long—
    though I know not how to relate them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will come and proclaim your mighty acts, Sovereign Lord;
    I will proclaim your righteous deeds, yours alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since my youth, God, you have taught me,
    and to this day I declare your marvelous deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even when I am old and gray,
    do not forsake me, my God,
till I declare your power to the next generation,
    your mighty acts to all who are to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your righteousness, God, reaches to the heavens,
    you who have done great things.
    Who is like you, God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though you have made me see troubles,
    many and bitter,
    you will restore my life again;
from the depths of the earth
    you will again bring me up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will increase my honor
    and comfort me once more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise you with the harp
    for your faithfulness, my God;
I will sing praise to you with the lyre,
    Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My lips will shout for joy
    when I sing praise to you—
    I whom you have delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tongue will tell of your righteous acts
    all day long,
for those who wanted to harm me
    have been put to shame and confusion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Endow the king with your justice, O God,
    the royal son with your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he judge your people in righteousness,
    your afflicted ones with justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the mountains bring prosperity to the people,
    the hills the fruit of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May he endure as long as the sun,
    as long as the moon, through all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he be like rain falling on a mown field,
    like showers watering the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his days may the righteous flourish
    and prosperity abound till the moon is no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he rule from sea to sea
    and from the River to the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the desert tribes bow before him
    and his enemies lick the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the kings of Tarshish and of distant shores
    bring tribute to him.
May the kings of Sheba and Seba
    present him gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May all kings bow down to him
    and all nations serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he will deliver the needy who cry out,
    the afflicted who have no one to help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will take pity on the weak and the needy
    and save the needy from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will rescue them from oppression and violence,
    for precious is their blood in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Long may he live!
    May gold from Sheba be given him.
May people ever pray for him
    and bless him all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May grain abound throughout the land;
    on the tops of the hills may it sway.
May the crops flourish like Lebanon
    and thrive like the grass of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his name endure forever;
    may it continue as long as the sun.
Then all nations will be blessed through him,
    and they will call him blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to the Lord God, the God of Israel,
    who alone does marvelous deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: This concludes the prayers of David son of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely God is good to Israel,
    to those who are pure in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, my feet had almost slipped;
    I had nearly lost my foothold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I envied the arrogant
    when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have no struggles;
    their bodies are healthy and strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are free from common human burdens;
    they are not plagued by human ills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore pride is their necklace;
    they clothe themselves with violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From their callous hearts comes iniquity;
    their evil imaginations have no limits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They scoff, and speak with malice;
    with arrogance they threaten oppression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their mouths lay claim to heaven,
    and their tongues take possession of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore their people turn to them
    and drink up waters in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say, “How would God know?
    Does the Most High know anything?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the wicked are like—
    always free of care, they go on amassing wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely in vain I have kept my heart pure
    and have washed my hands in innocence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long I have been afflicted,
    and every morning brings new punishments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I had spoken out like that,
    I would have betrayed your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I tried to understand all this,
    it troubled me deeply
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
till I entered the sanctuary of God;
    then I understood their final destiny.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely you place them on slippery ground;
    you cast them down to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How suddenly are they destroyed,
    completely swept away by terrors!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When my heart was grieved
    and my spirit embittered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was senseless and ignorant;
    I was a brute beast before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I am always with you;
    you hold me by my right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You guide me with your counsel,
    and afterward you will take me into glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom have I in heaven but you?
    And earth has nothing I desire besides you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh and my heart may fail,
    but God is the strength of my heart
    and my portion forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who are far from you will perish;
    you destroy all who are unfaithful to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O God, why have you rejected us forever?
    Why does your anger smolder against the sheep of your pasture?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember the nation you purchased long ago,
    the people of your inheritance, whom you redeemed—
    Mount Zion, where you dwelt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn your steps toward these everlasting ruins,
    all this destruction the enemy has brought on the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your foes roared in the place where you met with us;
    they set up their standards as signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They behaved like men wielding axes
    to cut through a thicket of trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They smashed all the carved paneling
    with their axes and hatchets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They burned your sanctuary to the ground;
    they defiled the dwelling place of your Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said in their hearts, “We will crush them completely!”
    They burned every place where God was worshiped in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How long will the enemy mock you, God?
    Will the foe revile your name forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you hold back your hand, your right hand?
    Take it from the folds of your garment and destroy them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God is my King from long ago;
    he brings salvation on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was you who split open the sea by your power;
    you broke the heads of the monster in the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was you who crushed the heads of Leviathan
    and gave it as food to the creatures of the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was you who opened up springs and streams;
    you dried up the ever-flowing rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The day is yours, and yours also the night;
    you established the sun and moon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was you who set all the boundaries of the earth;
    you made both summer and winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember how the enemy has mocked you, Lord,
    how foolish people have reviled your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not hand over the life of your dove to wild beasts;
    do not forget the lives of your afflicted people forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have regard for your covenant,
    because haunts of violence fill the dark places of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let the oppressed retreat in disgrace;
    may the poor and needy praise your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O God, and defend your cause;
    remember how fools mock you all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not ignore the clamor of your adversaries,
    the uproar of your enemies, which rises continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You say, “I choose the appointed time;
    it is I who judge with equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the earth and all its people quake,
    it is I who hold its pillars firm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the arrogant I say, ‘Boast no more,’
    and to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not lift your horns against heaven;
    do not speak so defiantly.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one from the east or the west
    or from the desert can exalt themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is God who judges:
    He brings one down, he exalts another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the hand of the Lord is a cup
    full of foaming wine mixed with spices;
he pours it out, and all the wicked of the earth
    drink it down to its very dregs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I will declare this forever;
    I will sing praise to the God of Jacob,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who says, “I will cut off the horns of all the wicked,
    but the horns of the righteous will be lifted up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is renowned in Judah;
    in Israel his name is great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His tent is in Salem,
    his dwelling place in Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There he broke the flashing arrows,
    the shields and the swords, the weapons of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are radiant with light,
    more majestic than mountains rich with game.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The valiant lie plundered,
    they sleep their last sleep;
not one of the warriors
    can lift his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At your rebuke, God of Jacob,
    both horse and chariot lie still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is you alone who are to be feared.
    Who can stand before you when you are angry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From heaven you pronounced judgment,
    and the land feared and was quiet—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when you, God, rose up to judge,
    to save all the afflicted of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely your wrath against mankind brings you praise,
    and the survivors of your wrath are restrained.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He breaks the spirit of rulers;
    he is feared by the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried out to God for help;
    I cried out to God to hear me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I remembered you, God, and I groaned;
    I meditated, and my spirit grew faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You kept my eyes from closing;
    I was too troubled to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I thought about the former days,
    the years of long ago;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I remembered my songs in the night.
    My heart meditated and my spirit asked:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Will the Lord reject forever?
    Will he never show his favor again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has his unfailing love vanished forever?
    Has his promise failed for all time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has God forgotten to be merciful?
    Has he in anger withheld his compassion?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I thought, “To this I will appeal:
    the years when the Most High stretched out his right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will remember the deeds of the Lord;
    yes, I will remember your miracles of long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will consider all your works
    and meditate on all your mighty deeds.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your ways, God, are holy.
    What god is as great as our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are the God who performs miracles;
    you display your power among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With your mighty arm you redeemed your people,
    the descendants of Jacob and Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your path led through the sea,
    your way through the mighty waters,
    though your footprints were not seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You led your people like a flock
    by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people, hear my teaching;
    listen to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will open my mouth with a parable;
    I will utter hidden things, things from of old—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
things we have heard and known,
    things our ancestors have told us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We will not hide them from their descendants;
    we will tell the next generation
the praiseworthy deeds of the Lord,
    his power, and the wonders he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He decreed statutes for Jacob
    and established the law in Israel,
which he commanded our ancestors
    to teach their children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so the next generation would know them,
    even the children yet to be born,
    and they in turn would tell their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they would put their trust in God
    and would not forget his deeds
    but would keep his commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They would not be like their ancestors—
    a stubborn and rebellious generation,
whose hearts were not loyal to God,
    whose spirits were not faithful to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The men of Ephraim, though armed with bows,
    turned back on the day of battle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they did not keep God’s covenant
    and refused to live by his law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They forgot what he had done,
    the wonders he had shown them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He did miracles in the sight of their ancestors
    in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He divided the sea and led them through;
    he made the water stand up like a wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He guided them with the cloud by day
    and with light from the fire all night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He split the rocks in the wilderness
    and gave them water as abundant as the seas;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he brought streams out of a rocky crag
    and made water flow down like rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they continued to sin against him,
    rebelling in the wilderness against the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They willfully put God to the test
    by demanding the food they craved.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
True, he struck the rock,
    and water gushed out,
    streams flowed abundantly,
but can he also give us bread?
    Can he supply meat for his people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
for they did not believe in God
    or trust in his deliverance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he gave a command to the skies above
    and opened the doors of the heavens;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he rained down manna for the people to eat,
    he gave them the grain of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Human beings ate the bread of angels;
    he sent them all the food they could eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He let loose the east wind from the heavens
    and by his power made the south wind blow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rained meat down on them like dust,
    birds like sand on the seashore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made them come down inside their camp,
    all around their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They ate till they were gorged—
    he had given them what they craved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But before they turned from what they craved,
    even while the food was still in their mouths,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In spite of all this, they kept on sinning;
    in spite of his wonders, they did not believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he ended their days in futility
    and their years in terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whenever God slew them, they would seek him;
    they eagerly turned to him again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They remembered that God was their Rock,
    that God Most High was their Redeemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But then they would flatter him with their mouths,
    lying to him with their tongues;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
their hearts were not loyal to him,
    they were not faithful to his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he was merciful;
    he forgave their iniquities
    and did not destroy them.
Time after time he restrained his anger
    and did not stir up his full wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He remembered that they were but flesh,
    a passing breeze that does not return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness
    and grieved him in the wasteland!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again and again they put God to the test;
    they vexed the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not remember his power—
    the day he redeemed them from the oppressor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the day he displayed his signs in Egypt,
    his wonders in the region of Zoan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned their river into blood;
    they could not drink from their streams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent swarms of flies that devoured them,
    and frogs that devastated them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave their crops to the grasshopper,
    their produce to the locust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He destroyed their vines with hail
    and their sycamore-figs with sleet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave over their cattle to the hail,
    their livestock to bolts of lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He unleashed against them his hot anger,
    his wrath, indignation and hostility—
    a band of destroying angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He struck down all the firstborn of Egypt,
    the firstfruits of manhood in the tents of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he brought his people out like a flock;
    he led them like sheep through the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He guided them safely, so they were unafraid;
    but the sea engulfed their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And so he brought them to the border of his holy land,
    to the hill country his right hand had taken.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Like their ancestors they were disloyal and faithless,
    as unreliable as a faulty bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They angered him with their high places;
    they aroused his jealousy with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When God heard them, he was furious;
    he rejected Israel completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He abandoned the tabernacle of Shiloh,
    the tent he had set up among humans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent the ark of his might into captivity,
    his splendor into the hands of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave his people over to the sword;
    he was furious with his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire consumed their young men,
    and their young women had no wedding songs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
their priests were put to the sword,
    and their widows could not weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord awoke as from sleep,
    as a warrior wakes from the stupor of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He beat back his enemies;
    he put them to everlasting shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he rejected the tents of Joseph,
    he did not choose the tribe of Ephraim;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but he chose the tribe of Judah,
    Mount Zion, which he loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He built his sanctuary like the heights,
    like the earth that he established forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He chose David his servant
    and took him from the sheep pens;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from tending the sheep he brought him
    to be the shepherd of his people Jacob,
    of Israel his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And David shepherded them with integrity of heart;
    with skillful hands he led them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have left the dead bodies of your servants
    as food for the birds of the sky,
    the flesh of your own people for the animals of the wild.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have poured out blood like water
    all around Jerusalem,
    and there is no one to bury the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We are objects of contempt to our neighbors,
    of scorn and derision to those around us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, Lord? Will you be angry forever?
    How long will your jealousy burn like fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your wrath on the nations
    that do not acknowledge you,
on the kingdoms
    that do not call on your name;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for they have devoured Jacob
    and devastated his homeland.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Help us, God our Savior,
    for the glory of your name;
deliver us and forgive our sins
    for your name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should the nations say,
    “Where is their God?”
Before our eyes, make known among the nations
    that you avenge the outpoured blood of your servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the groans of the prisoners come before you;
    with your strong arm preserve those condemned to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay back into the laps of our neighbors seven times
    the contempt they have hurled at you, Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then we your people, the sheep of your pasture,
    will praise you forever;
from generation to generation
    we will proclaim your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear us, Shepherd of Israel,
    you who lead Joseph like a flock.
You who sit enthroned between the cherubim,
    shine forth
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How long, Lord God Almighty,
    will your anger smolder
    against the prayers of your people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have fed them with the bread of tears;
    you have made them drink tears by the bowlful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us an object of derision to our neighbors,
    and our enemies mock us.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You transplanted a vine from Egypt;
    you drove out the nations and planted it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You cleared the ground for it,
    and it took root and filled the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains were covered with its shade,
    the mighty cedars with its branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Its branches reached as far as the Sea,
    its shoots as far as the River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why have you broken down its walls
    so that all who pass by pick its grapes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Boars from the forest ravage it,
    and insects from the fields feed on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return to us, God Almighty!
    Look down from heaven and see!
Watch over this vine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the root your right hand has planted,
    the son you have raised up for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your vine is cut down, it is burned with fire;
    at your rebuke your people perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your hand rest on the man at your right hand,
    the son of man you have raised up for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then we will not turn away from you;
    revive us, and we will call on your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Sing for joy to God our strength;
    shout aloud to the God of Jacob!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Begin the music, strike the timbrel,
    play the melodious harp and lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sound the ram’s horn at the New Moon,
    and when the moon is full, on the day of our festival;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
this is a decree for Israel,
    an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When God went out against Egypt,
    he established it as a statute for Joseph.
I heard an unknown voice say:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I removed the burden from their shoulders;
    their hands were set free from the basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear me, my people, and I will warn you—
    if you would only listen to me, Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall have no foreign god among you;
    you shall not worship any god other than me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the Lord your God,
    who brought you up out of Egypt.
Open wide your mouth and I will fill it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But my people would not listen to me;
    Israel would not submit to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I gave them over to their stubborn hearts
    to follow their own devices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If my people would only listen to me,
    if Israel would only follow my ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
how quickly I would subdue their enemies
    and turn my hand against their foes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who hate the Lord would cringe before him,
    and their punishment would last forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you would be fed with the finest of wheat;
    with honey from the rock I would satisfy you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God presides in the great assembly;
    he renders judgment among the “gods”:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long will you defend the unjust
    and show partiality to the wicked?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Defend the weak and the fatherless;
    uphold the cause of the poor and the oppressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue the weak and the needy;
    deliver them from the hand of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“I said, ‘You are “gods”;
    you are all sons of the Most High.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you will die like mere mortals;
    you will fall like every other ruler.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O God, judge the earth,
    for all the nations are your inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
See how your enemies growl,
    how your foes rear their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With cunning they conspire against your people;
    they plot against those you cherish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come,” they say, “let us destroy them as a nation,
    so that Israel’s name is remembered no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With one mind they plot together;
    they form an alliance against you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
    of Moab and the Hagrites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Byblos, Ammon and Amalek,
    Philistia, with the people of Tyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even Assyria has joined them
    to reinforce Lot’s descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do to them as you did to Midian,
    as you did to Sisera and Jabin at the river Kishon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who perished at Endor
    and became like dung on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb,
    all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who said, “Let us take possession
    of the pasturelands of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make them like tumbleweed, my God,
    like chaff before the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As fire consumes the forest
    or a flame sets the mountains ablaze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so pursue them with your tempest
    and terrify them with your storm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cover their faces with shame, Lord,
    so that they will seek your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they ever be ashamed and dismayed;
    may they perish in disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them know that you, whose name is the Lord—
    that you alone are the Most High over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How lovely is your dwelling place,
    Lord Almighty!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul yearns, even faints,
    for the courts of the Lord;
my heart and my flesh cry out
    for the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the sparrow has found a home,
    and the swallow a nest for herself,
    where she may have her young—
a place near your altar,
    Lord Almighty, my King and my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who dwell in your house;
    they are ever praising you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those whose strength is in you,
    whose hearts are set on pilgrimage.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They go from strength to strength,
    till each appears before God in Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my prayer, Lord God Almighty;
    listen to me, God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look on our shield, O God;
    look with favor on your anointed one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is one day in your courts
    than a thousand elsewhere;
I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God
    than dwell in the tents of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lord Almighty,
    blessed is the one who trusts in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, Lord, showed favor to your land;
    you restored the fortunes of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You forgave the iniquity of your people
    and covered all their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You set aside all your wrath
    and turned from your fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us again, God our Savior,
    and put away your displeasure toward us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you be angry with us forever?
    Will you prolong your anger through all generations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you not revive us again,
    that your people may rejoice in you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show us your unfailing love, Lord,
    and grant us your salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely his salvation is near those who fear him,
    that his glory may dwell in our land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Love and faithfulness meet together;
    righteousness and peace kiss each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Faithfulness springs forth from the earth,
    and righteousness looks down from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will indeed give what is good,
    and our land will yield its harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness goes before him
    and prepares the way for his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear me, Lord, and answer me,
    for I am poor and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
have mercy on me, Lord,
    for I call to you all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bring joy to your servant, Lord,
    for I put my trust in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, Lord, are forgiving and good,
    abounding in love to all who call to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my prayer, Lord;
    listen to my cry for mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I am in distress, I call to you,
    because you answer me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Among the gods there is none like you, Lord;
    no deeds can compare with yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For you are great and do marvelous deeds;
    you alone are God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me your way, Lord,
    that I may rely on your faithfulness;
give me an undivided heart,
    that I may fear your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise you, Lord my God, with all my heart;
    I will glorify your name forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But you, Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God,
    slow to anger, abounding in love and faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Give me a sign of your goodness,
    that my enemies may see it and be put to shame,
    for you, Lord, have helped me and comforted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has founded his city on the holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord loves the gates of Zion
    more than all the other dwellings of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glorious things are said of you,
    city of God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will record Rahab and Babylon
    among those who acknowledge me—
Philistia too, and Tyre, along with Cush—
    and will say, ‘This one was born in Zion.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, of Zion it will be said,
    “This one and that one were born in her,
    and the Most High himself will establish her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will write in the register of the peoples:
    “This one was born in Zion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As they make music they will sing,
    “All my fountains are in you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you are the God who saves me;
    day and night I cry out to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my prayer come before you;
    turn your ear to my cry.
