verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am overwhelmed with troubles
    and my life draws near to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am counted among those who go down to the pit;
    I am like one without strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am set apart with the dead,
    like the slain who lie in the grave,
whom you remember no more,
    who are cut off from your care.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have put me in the lowest pit,
    in the darkest depths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wrath lies heavily on me;
    you have overwhelmed me with all your waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do you show your wonders to the dead?
    Do their spirits rise up and praise you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is your love declared in the grave,
    your faithfulness in Destruction?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are your wonders known in the place of darkness,
    or your righteous deeds in the land of oblivion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I cry to you for help, Lord;
    in the morning my prayer comes before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, Lord, do you reject me
    and hide your face from me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From my youth I have suffered and been close to death;
    I have borne your terrors and am in despair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wrath has swept over me;
    your terrors have destroyed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long they surround me like a flood;
    they have completely engulfed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have taken from me friend and neighbor—
    darkness is my closest friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will declare that your love stands firm forever,
    that you have established your faithfulness in heaven itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You said, “I have made a covenant with my chosen one,
    I have sworn to David my servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I will establish your line forever
    and make your throne firm through all generations.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens praise your wonders, Lord,
    your faithfulness too, in the assembly of the holy ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For who in the skies above can compare with the Lord?
    Who is like the Lord among the heavenly beings?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the council of the holy ones God is greatly feared;
    he is more awesome than all who surround him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is like you, Lord God Almighty?
    You, Lord, are mighty, and your faithfulness surrounds you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You rule over the surging sea;
    when its waves mount up, you still them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You crushed Rahab like one of the slain;
    with your strong arm you scattered your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens are yours, and yours also the earth;
    you founded the world and all that is in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You created the north and the south;
    Tabor and Hermon sing for joy at your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your arm is endowed with power;
    your hand is strong, your right hand exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne;
    love and faithfulness go before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who have learned to acclaim you,
    who walk in the light of your presence, Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They rejoice in your name all day long;
    they celebrate your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you are their glory and strength,
    and by your favor you exalt our horn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, our shield belongs to the Lord,
    our king to the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once you spoke in a vision,
    to your faithful people you said:
“I have bestowed strength on a warrior;
    I have raised up a young man from among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have found David my servant;
    with my sacred oil I have anointed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My hand will sustain him;
    surely my arm will strengthen him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The enemy will not get the better of him;
    the wicked will not oppress him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will crush his foes before him
    and strike down his adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My faithful love will be with him,
    and through my name his horn will be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will set his hand over the sea,
    his right hand over the rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will call out to me, ‘You are my Father,
    my God, the Rock my Savior.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will appoint him to be my firstborn,
    the most exalted of the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will maintain my love to him forever,
    and my covenant with him will never fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will establish his line forever,
    his throne as long as the heavens endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If his sons forsake my law
    and do not follow my statutes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if they violate my decrees
    and fail to keep my commands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will punish their sin with the rod,
    their iniquity with flogging;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but I will not take my love from him,
    nor will I ever betray my faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not violate my covenant
    or alter what my lips have uttered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once for all, I have sworn by my holiness—
    and I will not lie to David—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that his line will continue forever
    and his throne endure before me like the sun;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
it will be established forever like the moon,
    the faithful witness in the sky.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you have rejected, you have spurned,
    you have been very angry with your anointed one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have renounced the covenant with your servant
    and have defiled his crown in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have broken through all his walls
    and reduced his strongholds to ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who pass by have plundered him;
    he has become the scorn of his neighbors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have exalted the right hand of his foes;
    you have made all his enemies rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, you have turned back the edge of his sword
    and have not supported him in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have put an end to his splendor
    and cast his throne to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have cut short the days of his youth;
    you have covered him with a mantle of shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, Lord? Will you hide yourself forever?
    How long will your wrath burn like fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember how fleeting is my life.
    For what futility you have created all humanity!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can live and not see death,
    or who can escape the power of the grave?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, where is your former great love,
    which in your faithfulness you swore to David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, Lord, how your servant has been mocked,
    how I bear in my heart the taunts of all the nations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the taunts with which your enemies, Lord, have mocked,
    with which they have mocked every step of your anointed one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to the Lord forever!
Amen and Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you have been our dwelling place
    throughout all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before the mountains were born
    or you brought forth the whole world,
    from everlasting to everlasting you are God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You turn people back to dust,
    saying, “Return to dust, you mortals.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A thousand years in your sight
    are like a day that has just gone by,
    or like a watch in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you sweep people away in the sleep of death—
    they are like the new grass of the morning:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the morning it springs up new,
    but by evening it is dry and withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We are consumed by your anger
    and terrified by your indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have set our iniquities before you,
    our secret sins in the light of your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All our days pass away under your wrath;
    we finish our years with a moan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our days may come to seventy years,
    or eighty, if our strength endures;
yet the best of them are but trouble and sorrow,
    for they quickly pass, and we fly away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If only we knew the power of your anger!
    Your wrath is as great as the fear that is your due.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach us to number our days,
    that we may gain a heart of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Relent, Lord! How long will it be?
    Have compassion on your servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Satisfy us in the morning with your unfailing love,
    that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us,
    for as many years as we have seen trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May your deeds be shown to your servants,
    your splendor to their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever dwells in the shelter of the Most High
    will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will say of the Lord, “He is my refuge and my fortress,
    my God, in whom I trust.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely he will save you
    from the fowler’s snare
    and from the deadly pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You will not fear the terror of night,
    nor the arrow that flies by day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
nor the pestilence that stalks in the darkness,
    nor the plague that destroys at midday.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A thousand may fall at your side,
    ten thousand at your right hand,
    but it will not come near you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will only observe with your eyes
    and see the punishment of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you say, “The Lord is my refuge,”
    and you make the Most High your dwelling,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
no harm will overtake you,
    no disaster will come near your tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he will command his angels concerning you
    to guard you in all your ways;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they will lift you up in their hands,
    so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will tread on the lion and the cobra;
    you will trample the great lion and the serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because he loves me,” says the Lord, “I will rescue him;
    I will protect him, for he acknowledges my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
With long life I will satisfy him
    and show him my salvation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good to praise the Lord
    and make music to your name, O Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
proclaiming your love in the morning
    and your faithfulness at night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to the music of the ten-stringed lyre
    and the melody of the harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you make me glad by your deeds, Lord;
    I sing for joy at what your hands have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How great are your works, Lord,
    how profound your thoughts!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Senseless people do not know,
    fools do not understand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that though the wicked spring up like grass
    and all evildoers flourish,
    they will be destroyed forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, Lord, are forever exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You have exalted my horn like that of a wild ox;
    fine oils have been poured on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes have seen the defeat of my adversaries;
    my ears have heard the rout of my wicked foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will flourish like a palm tree,
    they will grow like a cedar of Lebanon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
planted in the house of the Lord,
    they will flourish in the courts of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will still bear fruit in old age,
    they will stay fresh and green,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
proclaiming, “The Lord is upright;
    he is my Rock, and there is no wickedness in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your throne was established long ago;
    you are from all eternity.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Mightier than the thunder of the great waters,
    mightier than the breakers of the sea—
    the Lord on high is mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is a God who avenges.
    O God who avenges, shine forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, Judge of the earth;
    pay back to the proud what they deserve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, Lord, will the wicked,
    how long will the wicked be jubilant?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They pour out arrogant words;
    all the evildoers are full of boasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They crush your people, Lord;
    they oppress your inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They slay the widow and the foreigner;
    they murder the fatherless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say, “The Lord does not see;
    the God of Jacob takes no notice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take notice, you senseless ones among the people;
    you fools, when will you become wise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does he who fashioned the ear not hear?
    Does he who formed the eye not see?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does he who disciplines nations not punish?
    Does he who teaches mankind lack knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord knows all human plans;
    he knows that they are futile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the one you discipline, Lord,
    the one you teach from your law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you grant them relief from days of trouble,
    till a pit is dug for the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will not reject his people;
    he will never forsake his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judgment will again be founded on righteousness,
    and all the upright in heart will follow it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who will rise up for me against the wicked?
    Who will take a stand for me against evildoers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unless the Lord had given me help,
    I would soon have dwelt in the silence of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I said, “My foot is slipping,”
    your unfailing love, Lord, supported me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When anxiety was great within me,
    your consolation brought me joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a corrupt throne be allied with you—
    a throne that brings on misery by its decrees?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked band together against the righteous
    and condemn the innocent to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord has become my fortress,
    and my God the rock in whom I take refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let us sing for joy to the Lord;
    let us shout aloud to the Rock of our salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us come before him with thanksgiving
    and extol him with music and song.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord is the great God,
    the great King above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his hand are the depths of the earth,
    and the mountain peaks belong to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sea is his, for he made it,
    and his hands formed the dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let us bow down in worship,
    let us kneel before the Lord our Maker;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he is our God
    and we are the people of his pasture,
    the flock under his care.
Today, if only you would hear his voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do not harden your hearts as you did at Meribah,
    as you did that day at Massah in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
where your ancestors tested me;
    they tried me, though they had seen what I did.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So I declared on oath in my anger,
    ‘They shall never enter my rest.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord a new song;
    sing to the Lord, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord, praise his name;
    proclaim his salvation day after day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Declare his glory among the nations,
    his marvelous deeds among all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is the Lord and most worthy of praise;
    he is to be feared above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the gods of the nations are idols,
    but the Lord made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Splendor and majesty are before him;
    strength and glory are in his sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord, all you families of nations,
    ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory due his name;
    bring an offering and come into his courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Worship the Lord in the splendor of his holiness;
    tremble before him, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let the heavens rejoice, let the earth be glad;
    let the sea resound, and all that is in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the fields be jubilant, and everything in them;
    let all the trees of the forest sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all creation rejoice before the Lord, for he comes,
    he comes to judge the earth.
He will judge the world in righteousness
    and the peoples in his faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord reigns, let the earth be glad;
    let the distant shores rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clouds and thick darkness surround him;
    righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire goes before him
    and consumes his foes on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His lightning lights up the world;
    the earth sees and trembles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains melt like wax before the Lord,
    before the Lord of all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens proclaim his righteousness,
    and all peoples see his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who worship images are put to shame,
    those who boast in idols—
    worship him, all you gods!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zion hears and rejoices
    and the villages of Judah are glad
    because of your judgments, Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, Lord, are the Most High over all the earth;
    you are exalted far above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who love the Lord hate evil,
    for he guards the lives of his faithful ones
    and delivers them from the hand of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Light shines on the righteous
    and joy on the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice in the Lord, you who are righteous,
    and praise his holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord a new song,
    for he has done marvelous things;
his right hand and his holy arm
    have worked salvation for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has made his salvation known
    and revealed his righteousness to the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has remembered his love
    and his faithfulness to Israel;
all the ends of the earth have seen
    the salvation of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shout for joy to the Lord, all the earth,
    burst into jubilant song with music;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
make music to the Lord with the harp,
    with the harp and the sound of singing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with trumpets and the blast of the ram’s horn—
    shout for joy before the Lord, the King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the sea resound, and everything in it,
    the world, and all who live in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the rivers clap their hands,
    let the mountains sing together for joy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
let them sing before the Lord,
    for he comes to judge the earth.
He will judge the world in righteousness
    and the peoples with equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord reigns,
    let the nations tremble;
he sits enthroned between the cherubim,
    let the earth shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is the Lord in Zion;
    he is exalted over all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise your great and awesome name—
    he is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The King is mighty, he loves justice—
    you have established equity;
in Jacob you have done
    what is just and right.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Moses and Aaron were among his priests,
    Samuel was among those who called on his name;
they called on the Lord
    and he answered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud;
    they kept his statutes and the decrees he gave them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord our God,
    you answered them;
you were to Israel a forgiving God,
    though you punished their misdeeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Exalt the Lord our God
    and worship at his holy mountain,
    for the Lord our God is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shout for joy to the Lord, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Worship the Lord with gladness;
    come before him with joyful songs.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord is good and his love endures forever;
    his faithfulness continues through all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing of your love and justice;
    to you, Lord, I will sing praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will be careful to lead a blameless life—
    when will you come to me?
I will conduct the affairs of my house
    with a blameless heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not look with approval
    on anything that is vile.
I hate what faithless people do;
    I will have no part in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The perverse of heart shall be far from me;
    I will have nothing to do with what is evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever slanders their neighbor in secret,
    I will put to silence;
whoever has haughty eyes and a proud heart,
    I will not tolerate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes will be on the faithful in the land,
    that they may dwell with me;
the one whose walk is blameless
    will minister to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one who practices deceit
    will dwell in my house;
no one who speaks falsely
    will stand in my presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every morning I will put to silence
    all the wicked in the land;
I will cut off every evildoer
    from the city of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my prayer, Lord;
    let my cry for help come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not hide your face from me
    when I am in distress.
Turn your ear to me;
    when I call, answer me quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my days vanish like smoke;
    my bones burn like glowing embers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is blighted and withered like grass;
    I forget to eat my food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In my distress I groan aloud
    and am reduced to skin and bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am like a desert owl,
    like an owl among the ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lie awake; I have become
    like a bird alone on a roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long my enemies taunt me;
    those who rail against me use my name as a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I eat ashes as my food
    and mingle my drink with tears
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of your great wrath,
    for you have taken me up and thrown me aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My days are like the evening shadow;
    I wither away like grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, Lord, sit enthroned forever;
    your renown endures through all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For her stones are dear to your servants;
    her very dust moves them to pity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations will fear the name of the Lord,
    all the kings of the earth will revere your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will rebuild Zion
    and appear in his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will respond to the prayer of the destitute;
    he will not despise their plea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let this be written for a future generation,
    that a people not yet created may praise the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord looked down from his sanctuary on high,
    from heaven he viewed the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to hear the groans of the prisoners
    and release those condemned to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the name of the Lord will be declared in Zion
    and his praise in Jerusalem
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when the peoples and the kingdoms
    assemble to worship the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the course of my life he broke my strength;
    he cut short my days.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In the beginning you laid the foundations of the earth,
    and the heavens are the work of your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will perish, but you remain;
    they will all wear out like a garment.
Like clothing you will change them
    and they will be discarded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you remain the same,
    and your years will never end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children of your servants will live in your presence;
    their descendants will be established before you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord, my soul;
    all my inmost being, praise his holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord, my soul,
    and forget not all his benefits—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who forgives all your sins
    and heals all your diseases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who redeems your life from the pit
    and crowns you with love and compassion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who satisfies your desires with good things
    so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord works righteousness
    and justice for all the oppressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made known his ways to Moses,
    his deeds to the people of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is compassionate and gracious,
    slow to anger, abounding in love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not always accuse,
    nor will he harbor his anger forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he does not treat us as our sins deserve
    or repay us according to our iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For as high as the heavens are above the earth,
    so great is his love for those who fear him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as far as the east is from the west,
    so far has he removed our transgressions from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a father has compassion on his children,
    so the Lord has compassion on those who fear him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he knows how we are formed,
    he remembers that we are dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The life of mortals is like grass,
    they flourish like a flower of the field;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the wind blows over it and it is gone,
    and its place remembers it no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But from everlasting to everlasting
    the Lord’s love is with those who fear him,
    and his righteousness with their children’s children—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with those who keep his covenant
    and remember to obey his precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has established his throne in heaven,
    and his kingdom rules over all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord, you his angels,
    you mighty ones who do his bidding,
    who obey his word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord, all his heavenly hosts,
    you his servants who do his will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord, all his works
    everywhere in his dominion.
Praise the Lord, my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord wraps himself in light as with a garment;
    he stretches out the heavens like a tent
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and lays the beams of his upper chambers on their waters.
He makes the clouds his chariot
    and rides on the wings of the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes winds his messengers,
    flames of fire his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He set the earth on its foundations;
    it can never be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You covered it with the watery depths as with a garment;
    the waters stood above the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But at your rebuke the waters fled,
    at the sound of your thunder they took to flight;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they flowed over the mountains,
    they went down into the valleys,
    to the place you assigned for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You set a boundary they cannot cross;
    never again will they cover the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes springs pour water into the ravines;
    it flows between the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They give water to all the beasts of the field;
    the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The birds of the sky nest by the waters;
    they sing among the branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He waters the mountains from his upper chambers;
    the land is satisfied by the fruit of his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes grass grow for the cattle,
    and plants for people to cultivate—
    bringing forth food from the earth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
wine that gladdens human hearts,
    oil to make their faces shine,
    and bread that sustains their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The trees of the Lord are well watered,
    the cedars of Lebanon that he planted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the birds make their nests;
    the stork has its home in the junipers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The high mountains belong to the wild goats;
    the crags are a refuge for the hyrax.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made the moon to mark the seasons,
    and the sun knows when to go down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You bring darkness, it becomes night,
    and all the beasts of the forest prowl.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lions roar for their prey
    and seek their food from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun rises, and they steal away;
    they return and lie down in their dens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then people go out to their work,
    to their labor until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
There is the sea, vast and spacious,
    teeming with creatures beyond number—
    living things both large and small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the ships go to and fro,
    and Leviathan, which you formed to frolic there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All creatures look to you
    to give them their food at the proper time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you give it to them,
    they gather it up;
when you open your hand,
    they are satisfied with good things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you hide your face,
    they are terrified;
when you take away their breath,
    they die and return to the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you send your Spirit,
    they are created,
    and you renew the face of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the glory of the Lord endure forever;
    may the Lord rejoice in his works—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he who looks at the earth, and it trembles,
    who touches the mountains, and they smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing to the Lord all my life;
    I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my meditation be pleasing to him,
    as I rejoice in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But may sinners vanish from the earth
    and the wicked be no more.
Praise the Lord, my soul.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give praise to the Lord, proclaim his name;
    make known among the nations what he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to him, sing praise to him;
    tell of all his wonderful acts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glory in his holy name;
    let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look to the Lord and his strength;
    seek his face always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember the wonders he has done,
    his miracles, and the judgments he pronounced,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you his servants, the descendants of Abraham,
    his chosen ones, the children of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the Lord our God;
    his judgments are in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He remembers his covenant forever,
    the promise he made, for a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the covenant he made with Abraham,
    the oath he swore to Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree,
    to Israel as an everlasting covenant:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To you I will give the land of Canaan
    as the portion you will inherit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they were but few in number,
    few indeed, and strangers in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they wandered from nation to nation,
    from one kingdom to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He allowed no one to oppress them;
    for their sake he rebuked kings:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do not touch my anointed ones;
    do my prophets no harm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He called down famine on the land
    and destroyed all their supplies of food;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he sent a man before them—
    Joseph, sold as a slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They bruised his feet with shackles,
    his neck was put in irons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
till what he foretold came to pass,
    till the word of the Lord proved him true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king sent and released him,
    the ruler of peoples set him free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made him master of his household,
    ruler over all he possessed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to instruct his princes as he pleased
    and teach his elders wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Israel entered Egypt;
    Jacob resided as a foreigner in the land of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord made his people very fruitful;
    he made them too numerous for their foes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
whose hearts he turned to hate his people,
    to conspire against his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent Moses his servant,
    and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They performed his signs among them,
    his wonders in the land of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent darkness and made the land dark—
    for had they not rebelled against his words?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned their waters into blood,
    causing their fish to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their land teemed with frogs,
    which went up into the bedrooms of their rulers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spoke, and there came swarms of flies,
    and gnats throughout their country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned their rain into hail,
    with lightning throughout their land;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he struck down their vines and fig trees
    and shattered the trees of their country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spoke, and the locusts came,
    grasshoppers without number;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they ate up every green thing in their land,
    ate up the produce of their soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he struck down all the firstborn in their land,
    the firstfruits of all their manhood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought out Israel, laden with silver and gold,
    and from among their tribes no one faltered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt was glad when they left,
    because dread of Israel had fallen on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spread out a cloud as a covering,
    and a fire to give light at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked, and he brought them quail;
    he fed them well with the bread of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He opened the rock, and water gushed out;
    it flowed like a river in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he remembered his holy promise
    given to his servant Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought out his people with rejoicing,
    his chosen ones with shouts of joy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he gave them the lands of the nations,
    and they fell heir to what others had toiled for—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that they might keep his precepts
    and observe his laws.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who can proclaim the mighty acts of the Lord
    or fully declare his praise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who act justly,
    who always do what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember me, Lord, when you show favor to your people,
    come to my aid when you save them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that I may enjoy the prosperity of your chosen ones,
    that I may share in the joy of your nation
    and join your inheritance in giving praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have sinned, even as our ancestors did;
    we have done wrong and acted wickedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When our ancestors were in Egypt,
    they gave no thought to your miracles;
they did not remember your many kindnesses,
    and they rebelled by the sea, the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he saved them for his name’s sake,
    to make his mighty power known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up;
    he led them through the depths as through a desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He saved them from the hand of the foe;
    from the hand of the enemy he redeemed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters covered their adversaries;
    not one of them survived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they believed his promises
    and sang his praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they soon forgot what he had done
    and did not wait for his plan to unfold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the desert they gave in to their craving;
    in the wilderness they put God to the test.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he gave them what they asked for,
    but sent a wasting disease among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the camp they grew envious of Moses
    and of Aaron, who was consecrated to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan;
    it buried the company of Abiram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire blazed among their followers;
    a flame consumed the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At Horeb they made a calf
    and worshiped an idol cast from metal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They exchanged their glorious God
    for an image of a bull, which eats grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They forgot the God who saved them,
    who had done great things in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
miracles in the land of Ham
    and awesome deeds by the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he said he would destroy them—
    had not Moses, his chosen one,
stood in the breach before him
    to keep his wrath from destroying them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they despised the pleasant land;
    they did not believe his promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They grumbled in their tents
    and did not obey the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he swore to them with uplifted hand
    that he would make them fall in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
make their descendants fall among the nations
    and scatter them throughout the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor
    and ate sacrifices offered to lifeless gods;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they aroused the Lord’s anger by their wicked deeds,
    and a plague broke out among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Phinehas stood up and intervened,
    and the plague was checked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This was credited to him as righteousness
    for endless generations to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the waters of Meribah they angered the Lord,
    and trouble came to Moses because of them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for they rebelled against the Spirit of God,
    and rash words came from Moses’ lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not destroy the peoples
    as the Lord had commanded them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but they mingled with the nations
    and adopted their customs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They worshiped their idols,
    which became a snare to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sacrificed their sons
    and their daughters to false gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shed innocent blood,
    the blood of their sons and daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan,
    and the land was desecrated by their blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They defiled themselves by what they did;
    by their deeds they prostituted themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord was angry with his people
    and abhorred his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave them into the hands of the nations,
    and their foes ruled over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their enemies oppressed them
    and subjected them to their power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many times he delivered them,
    but they were bent on rebellion
    and they wasted away in their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he took note of their distress
    when he heard their cry;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for their sake he remembered his covenant
    and out of his great love he relented.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He caused all who held them captive
    to show them mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save us, Lord our God,
    and gather us from the nations,
that we may give thanks to your holy name
    and glory in your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting.
Let all the people say, “Amen!”
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;
    his love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the redeemed of the Lord tell their story—
    those he redeemed from the hand of the foe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those he gathered from the lands,
    from east and west, from north and south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some wandered in desert wastelands,
    finding no way to a city where they could settle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were hungry and thirsty,
    and their lives ebbed away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he delivered them from their distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He led them by a straight way
    to a city where they could settle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for his unfailing love
    and his wonderful deeds for mankind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he satisfies the thirsty
    and fills the hungry with good things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some sat in darkness, in utter darkness,
    prisoners suffering in iron chains,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they rebelled against God’s commands
    and despised the plans of the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he subjected them to bitter labor;
    they stumbled, and there was no one to help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he saved them from their distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought them out of darkness, the utter darkness,
    and broke away their chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for his unfailing love
    and his wonderful deeds for mankind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he breaks down gates of bronze
    and cuts through bars of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some became fools through their rebellious ways
    and suffered affliction because of their iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They loathed all food
    and drew near the gates of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he saved them from their distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent out his word and healed them;
    he rescued them from the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for his unfailing love
    and his wonderful deeds for mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them sacrifice thank offerings
    and tell of his works with songs of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some went out on the sea in ships;
    they were merchants on the mighty waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They saw the works of the Lord,
    his wonderful deeds in the deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he spoke and stirred up a tempest
    that lifted high the waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They mounted up to the heavens and went down to the depths;
    in their peril their courage melted away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They reeled and staggered like drunkards;
    they were at their wits’ end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble,
    and he brought them out of their distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stilled the storm to a whisper;
    the waves of the sea were hushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were glad when it grew calm,
    and he guided them to their desired haven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for his unfailing love
    and his wonderful deeds for mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people
    and praise him in the council of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned rivers into a desert,
    flowing springs into thirsty ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and fruitful land into a salt waste,
    because of the wickedness of those who lived there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned the desert into pools of water
    and the parched ground into flowing springs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
there he brought the hungry to live,
    and they founded a city where they could settle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sowed fields and planted vineyards
    that yielded a fruitful harvest;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he blessed them, and their numbers greatly increased,
    and he did not let their herds diminish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then their numbers decreased, and they were humbled
    by oppression, calamity and sorrow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he who pours contempt on nobles
    made them wander in a trackless waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he lifted the needy out of their affliction
    and increased their families like flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The upright see and rejoice,
    but all the wicked shut their mouths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the one who is wise heed these things
    and ponder the loving deeds of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart, O God, is steadfast;
    I will sing and make music with all my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, harp and lyre!
    I will awaken the dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise you, Lord, among the nations;
    I will sing of you among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is your love, higher than the heavens;
    your faithfulness reaches to the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens;
    let your glory be over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save us and help us with your right hand,
    that those you love may be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has spoken from his sanctuary:
    “In triumph I will parcel out Shechem
    and measure off the Valley of Sukkoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who will bring me to the fortified city?
    Who will lead me to Edom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it not you, God, you who have rejected us
    and no longer go out with our armies?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give us aid against the enemy,
    for human help is worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With God we will gain the victory,
    and he will trample down our enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God, whom I praise,
    do not remain silent,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
With words of hatred they surround me;
    they attack me without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In return for my friendship they accuse me,
    but I am a man of prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They repay me evil for good,
    and hatred for my friendship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Appoint someone evil to oppose my enemy;
    let an accuser stand at his right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he is tried, let him be found guilty,
    and may his prayers condemn him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his days be few;
    may another take his place of leadership.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his children be fatherless
    and his wife a widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his children be wandering beggars;
    may they be driven from their ruined homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May a creditor seize all he has;
    may strangers plunder the fruits of his labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May no one extend kindness to him
    or take pity on his fatherless children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his descendants be cut off,
    their names blotted out from the next generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the Lord;
    may the sin of his mother never be blotted out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May their sins always remain before the Lord,
    that he may blot out their name from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he never thought of doing a kindness,
    but hounded to death the poor
    and the needy and the brokenhearted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He loved to pronounce a curse—
    may it come back on him.
He found no pleasure in blessing—
    may it be far from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May it be like a cloak wrapped about him,
    like a belt tied forever around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May this be the Lord’s payment to my accusers,
    to those who speak evil of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I am poor and needy,
    and my heart is wounded within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I fade away like an evening shadow;
    I am shaken off like a locust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My knees give way from fasting;
    my body is thin and gaunt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am an object of scorn to my accusers;
    when they see me, they shake their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Help me, Lord my God;
    save me according to your unfailing love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them know that it is your hand,
    that you, Lord, have done it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May my accusers be clothed with disgrace
    and wrapped in shame as in a cloak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my mouth I will greatly extol the Lord;
    in the great throng of worshipers I will praise him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he stands at the right hand of the needy,
    to save their lives from those who would condemn them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord says to my lord:
“Sit at my right hand
    until I make your enemies
    a footstool for your feet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will extend your mighty scepter from Zion, saying,
    “Rule in the midst of your enemies!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your troops will be willing
    on your day of battle.
Arrayed in holy splendor,
    your young men will come to you
    like dew from the morning’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has sworn
    and will not change his mind:
“You are a priest forever,
    in the order of Melchizedek.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is at your right hand;
    he will crush kings on the day of his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will judge the nations, heaping up the dead
    and crushing the rulers of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will drink from a brook along the way,
    and so he will lift his head high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord.
I will extol the Lord with all my heart
    in the council of the upright and in the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great are the works of the Lord;
    they are pondered by all who delight in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glorious and majestic are his deeds,
    and his righteousness endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has caused his wonders to be remembered;
    the Lord is gracious and compassionate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He provides food for those who fear him;
    he remembers his covenant forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has shown his people the power of his works,
    giving them the lands of other nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The works of his hands are faithful and just;
    all his precepts are trustworthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are established for ever and ever,
    enacted in faithfulness and uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord.
Blessed are those who fear the Lord,
    who find great delight in his commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their children will be mighty in the land;
    the generation of the upright will be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth and riches are in their houses,
    and their righteousness endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even in darkness light dawns for the upright,
    for those who are gracious and compassionate and righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good will come to those who are generous and lend freely,
    who conduct their affairs with justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the righteous will never be shaken;
    they will be remembered forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will have no fear of bad news;
    their hearts are steadfast, trusting in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their hearts are secure, they will have no fear;
    in the end they will look in triumph on their foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let the name of the Lord be praised,
    both now and forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the rising of the sun to the place where it sets,
    the name of the Lord is to be praised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is exalted over all the nations,
    his glory above the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is like the Lord our God,
    the One who sits enthroned on high,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who stoops down to look
    on the heavens and the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He raises the poor from the dust
    and lifts the needy from the ash heap;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he seats them with princes,
    with the princes of his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He settles the childless woman in her home
    as a happy mother of children.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Israel came out of Egypt,
    Jacob from a people of foreign tongue,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah became God’s sanctuary,
    Israel his dominion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sea looked and fled,
    the Jordan turned back;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the mountains leaped like rams,
    the hills like lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why was it, sea, that you fled?
    Why, Jordan, did you turn back?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, mountains, did you leap like rams,
    you hills, like lambs?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tremble, earth, at the presence of the Lord,
    at the presence of the God of Jacob,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who turned the rock into a pool,
    the hard rock into springs of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Not to us, Lord, not to us
    but to your name be the glory,
    because of your love and faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do the nations say,
    “Where is their God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our God is in heaven;
    he does whatever pleases him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But their idols are silver and gold,
    made by human hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have mouths, but cannot speak,
    eyes, but cannot see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have ears, but cannot hear,
    noses, but cannot smell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have hands, but cannot feel,
    feet, but cannot walk,
    nor can they utter a sound with their throats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who make them will be like them,
    and so will all who trust in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All you Israelites, trust in the Lord—
    he is their help and shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
House of Aaron, trust in the Lord—
    he is their help and shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who fear him, trust in the Lord—
    he is their help and shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord remembers us and will bless us:
    He will bless his people Israel,
    he will bless the house of Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he will bless those who fear the Lord—
    small and great alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord cause you to flourish,
    both you and your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May you be blessed by the Lord,
    the Maker of heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The highest heavens belong to the Lord,
    but the earth he has given to mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not the dead who praise the Lord,
    those who go down to the place of silence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
it is we who extol the Lord,
    both now and forevermore.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I love the Lord, for he heard my voice;
    he heard my cry for mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he turned his ear to me,
    I will call on him as long as I live.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then I called on the name of the Lord:
    “Lord, save me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is gracious and righteous;
    our God is full of compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord protects the unwary;
    when I was brought low, he saved me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return to your rest, my soul,
    for the Lord has been good to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, Lord, have delivered me from death,
    my eyes from tears,
    my feet from stumbling,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that I may walk before the Lord
    in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I trusted in the Lord when I said,
    “I am greatly afflicted”;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in my alarm I said,
    “Everyone is a liar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What shall I return to the Lord
    for all his goodness to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will lift up the cup of salvation
    and call on the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will fulfill my vows to the Lord
    in the presence of all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Precious in the sight of the Lord
    is the death of his faithful servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will sacrifice a thank offering to you
    and call on the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will fulfill my vows to the Lord
    in the presence of all his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in the courts of the house of the Lord—
    in your midst, Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord, all you nations;
    extol him, all you peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is his love toward us,
    and the faithfulness of the Lord endures forever.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;
    his love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Israel say:
    “His love endures forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the house of Aaron say:
    “His love endures forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who fear the Lord say:
    “His love endures forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When hard pressed, I cried to the Lord;
    he brought me into a spacious place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is with me; I will not be afraid.
    What can mere mortals do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is with me; he is my helper.
    I look in triumph on my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
    than to trust in humans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
    than to trust in princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the nations surrounded me,
    but in the name of the Lord I cut them down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They surrounded me on every side,
    but in the name of the Lord I cut them down.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I was pushed back and about to fall,
    but the Lord helped me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is my strength and my defense;
    he has become my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shouts of joy and victory
    resound in the tents of the righteous:
“The Lord’s right hand has done mighty things!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord’s right hand is lifted high;
    the Lord’s right hand has done mighty things!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not die but live,
    and will proclaim what the Lord has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has chastened me severely,
    but he has not given me over to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open for me the gates of the righteous;
    I will enter and give thanks to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the gate of the Lord
    through which the righteous may enter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give you thanks, for you answered me;
    you have become my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The stone the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the Lord has done this,
    and it is marvelous in our eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has done it this very day;
    let us rejoice today and be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, save us!
    Lord, grant us success!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.
    From the house of the Lord we bless you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is God,
    and he has made his light shine on us.
With boughs in hand, join in the festal procession
    up to the horns of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my God, and I will praise you;
    you are my God, and I will exalt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;
    his love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those whose ways are blameless,
    who walk according to the law of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who keep his statutes
    and seek him with all their heart—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they do no wrong
    but follow his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have laid down precepts
    that are to be fully obeyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that my ways were steadfast
    in obeying your decrees!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I would not be put to shame
    when I consider all your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise you with an upright heart
    as I learn your righteous laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will obey your decrees;
    do not utterly forsake me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can a young person stay on the path of purity?
    By living according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I seek you with all my heart;
    do not let me stray from your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have hidden your word in my heart
    that I might not sin against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to you, Lord;
    teach me your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my lips I recount
    all the laws that come from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rejoice in following your statutes
    as one rejoices in great riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I meditate on your precepts
    and consider your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I delight in your decrees;
    I will not neglect your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be good to your servant while I live,
    that I may obey your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open my eyes that I may see
    wonderful things in your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am a stranger on earth;
    do not hide your commands from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul is consumed with longing
    for your laws at all times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You rebuke the arrogant, who are accursed,
    those who stray from your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove from me their scorn and contempt,
    for I keep your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though rulers sit together and slander me,
    your servant will meditate on your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your statutes are my delight;
    they are my counselors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am laid low in the dust;
    preserve my life according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I gave an account of my ways and you answered me;
    teach me your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cause me to understand the way of your precepts,
    that I may meditate on your wonderful deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul is weary with sorrow;
    strengthen me according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep me from deceitful ways;
    be gracious to me and teach me your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have chosen the way of faithfulness;
    I have set my heart on your laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hold fast to your statutes, Lord;
    do not let me be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I run in the path of your commands,
    for you have broadened my understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me, Lord, the way of your decrees,
    that I may follow it to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give me understanding, so that I may keep your law
    and obey it with all my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Direct me in the path of your commands,
    for there I find delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn my heart toward your statutes
    and not toward selfish gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn my eyes away from worthless things;
    preserve my life according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fulfill your promise to your servant,
    so that you may be feared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take away the disgrace I dread,
    for your laws are good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How I long for your precepts!
    In your righteousness preserve my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May your unfailing love come to me, Lord,
    your salvation, according to your promise;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then I can answer anyone who taunts me,
    for I trust in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Never take your word of truth from my mouth,
    for I have put my hope in your laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will always obey your law,
    for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will walk about in freedom,
    for I have sought out your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will speak of your statutes before kings
    and will not be put to shame,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for I delight in your commands
    because I love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I reach out for your commands, which I love,
    that I may meditate on your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember your word to your servant,
    for you have given me hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My comfort in my suffering is this:
    Your promise preserves my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant mock me unmercifully,
    but I do not turn from your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I remember, Lord, your ancient laws,
    and I find comfort in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indignation grips me because of the wicked,
    who have forsaken your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your decrees are the theme of my song
    wherever I lodge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the night, Lord, I remember your name,
    that I may keep your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This has been my practice:
    I obey your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my portion, Lord;
    I have promised to obey your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have sought your face with all my heart;
    be gracious to me according to your promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have considered my ways
    and have turned my steps to your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will hasten and not delay
    to obey your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though the wicked bind me with ropes,
    I will not forget your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At midnight I rise to give you thanks
    for your righteous laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am a friend to all who fear you,
    to all who follow your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth is filled with your love, Lord;
    teach me your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do good to your servant
    according to your word, Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me knowledge and good judgment,
    for I trust your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before I was afflicted I went astray,
    but now I obey your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are good, and what you do is good;
    teach me your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though the arrogant have smeared me with lies,
    I keep your precepts with all my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their hearts are callous and unfeeling,
    but I delight in your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was good for me to be afflicted
    so that I might learn your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The law from your mouth is more precious to me
    than thousands of pieces of silver and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your hands made me and formed me;
    give me understanding to learn your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who fear you rejoice when they see me,
    for I have put my hope in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know, Lord, that your laws are righteous,
    and that in faithfulness you have afflicted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May your unfailing love be my comfort,
    according to your promise to your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your compassion come to me that I may live,
    for your law is my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the arrogant be put to shame for wronging me without cause;
    but I will meditate on your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who fear you turn to me,
    those who understand your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May I wholeheartedly follow your decrees,
    that I may not be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul faints with longing for your salvation,
    but I have put my hope in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes fail, looking for your promise;
    I say, “When will you comfort me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I am like a wineskin in the smoke,
    I do not forget your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long must your servant wait?
    When will you punish my persecutors?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant dig pits to trap me,
    contrary to your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your commands are trustworthy;
    help me, for I am being persecuted without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They almost wiped me from the earth,
    but I have not forsaken your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In your unfailing love preserve my life,
    that I may obey the statutes of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your word, Lord, is eternal;
    it stands firm in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your faithfulness continues through all generations;
    you established the earth, and it endures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your laws endure to this day,
    for all things serve you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If your law had not been my delight,
    I would have perished in my affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will never forget your precepts,
    for by them you have preserved my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save me, for I am yours;
    I have sought out your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked are waiting to destroy me,
    but I will ponder your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To all perfection I see a limit,
    but your commands are boundless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, how I love your law!
    I meditate on it all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your commands are always with me
    and make me wiser than my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have more insight than all my teachers,
    for I meditate on your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have more understanding than the elders,
    for I obey your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have kept my feet from every evil path
    so that I might obey your word.
