verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not departed from your laws,
    for you yourself have taught me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How sweet are your words to my taste,
    sweeter than honey to my mouth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I gain understanding from your precepts;
    therefore I hate every wrong path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your word is a lamp for my feet,
    a light on my path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have taken an oath and confirmed it,
    that I will follow your righteous laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have suffered much;
    preserve my life, Lord, according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Accept, Lord, the willing praise of my mouth,
    and teach me your laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I constantly take my life in my hands,
    I will not forget your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked have set a snare for me,
    but I have not strayed from your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your statutes are my heritage forever;
    they are the joy of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is set on keeping your decrees
    to the very end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate double-minded people,
    but I love your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my refuge and my shield;
    I have put my hope in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Away from me, you evildoers,
    that I may keep the commands of my God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sustain me, my God, according to your promise, and I will live;
    do not let my hopes be dashed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uphold me, and I will be delivered;
    I will always have regard for your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You reject all who stray from your decrees,
    for their delusions come to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the wicked of the earth you discard like dross;
    therefore I love your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh trembles in fear of you;
    I stand in awe of your laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have done what is righteous and just;
    do not leave me to my oppressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ensure your servant’s well-being;
    do not let the arrogant oppress me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes fail, looking for your salvation,
    looking for your righteous promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deal with your servant according to your love
    and teach me your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am your servant; give me discernment
    that I may understand your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is time for you to act, Lord;
    your law is being broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because I love your commands
    more than gold, more than pure gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and because I consider all your precepts right,
    I hate every wrong path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your statutes are wonderful;
    therefore I obey them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The unfolding of your words gives light;
    it gives understanding to the simple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I open my mouth and pant,
    longing for your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn to me and have mercy on me,
    as you always do to those who love your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Direct my footsteps according to your word;
    let no sin rule over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Redeem me from human oppression,
    that I may obey your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make your face shine on your servant
    and teach me your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Streams of tears flow from my eyes,
    for your law is not obeyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are righteous, Lord,
    and your laws are right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The statutes you have laid down are righteous;
    they are fully trustworthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My zeal wears me out,
    for my enemies ignore your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your promises have been thoroughly tested,
    and your servant loves them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I am lowly and despised,
    I do not forget your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your righteousness is everlasting
    and your law is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trouble and distress have come upon me,
    but your commands give me delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your statutes are always righteous;
    give me understanding that I may live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call with all my heart; answer me, Lord,
    and I will obey your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call out to you; save me
    and I will keep your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rise before dawn and cry for help;
    I have put my hope in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes stay open through the watches of the night,
    that I may meditate on your promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my voice in accordance with your love;
    preserve my life, Lord, according to your laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who devise wicked schemes are near,
    but they are far from your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you are near, Lord,
    and all your commands are true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Long ago I learned from your statutes
    that you established them to last forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look on my suffering and deliver me,
    for I have not forgotten your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Defend my cause and redeem me;
    preserve my life according to your promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Salvation is far from the wicked,
    for they do not seek out your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your compassion, Lord, is great;
    preserve my life according to your laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are the foes who persecute me,
    but I have not turned from your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I look on the faithless with loathing,
    for they do not obey your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See how I love your precepts;
    preserve my life, Lord, in accordance with your love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your words are true;
    all your righteous laws are eternal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rulers persecute me without cause,
    but my heart trembles at your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rejoice in your promise
    like one who finds great spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate and detest falsehood
    but I love your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seven times a day I praise you
    for your righteous laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great peace have those who love your law,
    and nothing can make them stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I wait for your salvation, Lord,
    and I follow your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I obey your statutes,
    for I love them greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I obey your precepts and your statutes,
    for all my ways are known to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my cry come before you, Lord;
    give me understanding according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my supplication come before you;
    deliver me according to your promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my lips overflow with praise,
    for you teach me your decrees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my tongue sing of your word,
    for all your commands are righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May your hand be ready to help me,
    for I have chosen your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I long for your salvation, Lord,
    and your law gives me delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me live that I may praise you,
    and may your laws sustain me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have strayed like a lost sheep.
    Seek your servant,
    for I have not forgotten your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call on the Lord in my distress,
    and he answers me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save me, Lord,
    from lying lips
    and from deceitful tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What will he do to you,
    and what more besides,
    you deceitful tongue?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will punish you with a warrior’s sharp arrows,
    with burning coals of the broom bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to me that I dwell in Meshek,
    that I live among the tents of Kedar!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Too long have I lived
    among those who hate peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am for peace;
    but when I speak, they are for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lift up my eyes to the mountains—
    where does my help come from?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My help comes from the Lord,
    the Maker of heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not let your foot slip—
    he who watches over you will not slumber;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
indeed, he who watches over Israel
    will neither slumber nor sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord watches over you—
    the Lord is your shade at your right hand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the sun will not harm you by day,
    nor the moon by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will keep you from all harm—
    he will watch over your life;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the Lord will watch over your coming and going
    both now and forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rejoiced with those who said to me,
    “Let us go to the house of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our feet are standing
    in your gates, Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem is built like a city
    that is closely compacted together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is where the tribes go up—
    the tribes of the Lord—
to praise the name of the Lord
    according to the statute given to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There stand the thrones for judgment,
    the thrones of the house of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
    “May those who love you be secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May there be peace within your walls
    and security within your citadels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of my family and friends,
    I will say, “Peace be within you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of the house of the Lord our God,
    I will seek your prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lift up my eyes to you,
    to you who sit enthroned in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the eyes of slaves look to the hand of their master,
    as the eyes of a female slave look to the hand of her mistress,
so our eyes look to the Lord our God,
    till he shows us his mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy on us, Lord, have mercy on us,
    for we have endured no end of contempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have endured no end
    of ridicule from the arrogant,
    of contempt from the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the Lord had not been on our side—
    let Israel say—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if the Lord had not been on our side
    when people attacked us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they would have swallowed us alive
    when their anger flared against us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the flood would have engulfed us,
    the torrent would have swept over us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the raging waters
    would have swept us away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to the Lord,
    who has not let us be torn by their teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have escaped like a bird
    from the fowler’s snare;
the snare has been broken,
    and we have escaped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our help is in the name of the Lord,
    the Maker of heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion,
    which cannot be shaken but endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the mountains surround Jerusalem,
    so the Lord surrounds his people
    both now and forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The scepter of the wicked will not remain
    over the land allotted to the righteous,
for then the righteous might use
    their hands to do evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, do good to those who are good,
    to those who are upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But those who turn to crooked ways
    the Lord will banish with the evildoers.
Peace be on Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Lord restored the fortunes of Zion,
    we were like those who dreamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our mouths were filled with laughter,
    our tongues with songs of joy.
Then it was said among the nations,
    “The Lord has done great things for them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has done great things for us,
    and we are filled with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore our fortunes, Lord,
    like streams in the Negev.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who sow with tears
    will reap with songs of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who go out weeping,
    carrying seed to sow,
will return with songs of joy,
    carrying sheaves with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unless the Lord builds the house,
    the builders labor in vain.
Unless the Lord watches over the city,
    the guards stand watch in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In vain you rise early
    and stay up late,
toiling for food to eat—
    for he grants sleep to those he loves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Children are a heritage from the Lord,
    offspring a reward from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like arrows in the hands of a warrior
    are children born in one’s youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the man
    whose quiver is full of them.
They will not be put to shame
    when they contend with their opponents in court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are all who fear the Lord,
    who walk in obedience to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will eat the fruit of your labor;
    blessings and prosperity will be yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wife will be like a fruitful vine
    within your house;
your children will be like olive shoots
    around your table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, this will be the blessing
    for the man who fears the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May you live to see your children’s children—
    peace be on Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They have greatly oppressed me from my youth,”
    let Israel say;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“they have greatly oppressed me from my youth,
    but they have not gained the victory over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plowmen have plowed my back
    and made their furrows long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord is righteous;
    he has cut me free from the cords of the wicked.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May all who hate Zion
    be turned back in shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they be like grass on the roof,
    which withers before it can grow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a reaper cannot fill his hands with it,
    nor one who gathers fill his arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Out of the depths I cry to you, Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, hear my voice.
Let your ears be attentive
    to my cry for mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you, Lord, kept a record of sins,
    Lord, who could stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But with you there is forgiveness,
    so that we can, with reverence, serve you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I wait for the Lord, my whole being waits,
    and in his word I put my hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I wait for the Lord
    more than watchmen wait for the morning,
    more than watchmen wait for the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel, put your hope in the Lord,
    for with the Lord is unfailing love
    and with him is full redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He himself will redeem Israel
    from all their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is not proud, Lord,
    my eyes are not haughty;
I do not concern myself with great matters
    or things too wonderful for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Israel, put your hope in the Lord
    both now and forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, remember David
    and all his self-denial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He swore an oath to the Lord,
    he made a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will not enter my house
    or go to my bed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will allow no sleep to my eyes
    or slumber to my eyelids,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
till I find a place for the Lord,
    a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We heard it in Ephrathah,
    we came upon it in the fields of Jaar:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Let us go to his dwelling place,
    let us worship at his footstool, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Arise, Lord, and come to your resting place,
    you and the ark of your might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May your priests be clothed with your righteousness;
    may your faithful people sing for joy.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of your servant David,
    do not reject your anointed one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord swore an oath to David,
    a sure oath he will not revoke:
“One of your own descendants
    I will place on your throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If your sons keep my covenant
    and the statutes I teach them,
then their sons will sit
    on your throne for ever and ever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord has chosen Zion,
    he has desired it for his dwelling, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is my resting place for ever and ever;
    here I will sit enthroned, for I have desired it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bless her with abundant provisions;
    her poor I will satisfy with food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will clothe her priests with salvation,
    and her faithful people will ever sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Here I will make a horn grow for David
    and set up a lamp for my anointed one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will clothe his enemies with shame,
    but his head will be adorned with a radiant crown.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How good and pleasant it is
    when God’s people live together in unity!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is like precious oil poured on the head,
    running down on the beard,
running down on Aaron’s beard,
    down on the collar of his robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is as if the dew of Hermon
    were falling on Mount Zion.
For there the Lord bestows his blessing,
    even life forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord, all you servants of the Lord
    who minister by night in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your hands in the sanctuary
    and praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord bless you from Zion,
    he who is the Maker of heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
you who minister in the house of the Lord,
    in the courts of the house of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good;
    sing praise to his name, for that is pleasant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord has chosen Jacob to be his own,
    Israel to be his treasured possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know that the Lord is great,
    that our Lord is greater than all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord does whatever pleases him,
    in the heavens and on the earth,
    in the seas and all their depths.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
    the firstborn of people and animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent his signs and wonders into your midst, Egypt,
    against Pharaoh and all his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He struck down many nations
    and killed mighty kings—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sihon king of the Amorites,
    Og king of Bashan,
    and all the kings of Canaan—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he gave their land as an inheritance,
    an inheritance to his people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your name, Lord, endures forever,
    your renown, Lord, through all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will vindicate his people
    and have compassion on his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
    made by human hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have mouths, but cannot speak,
    eyes, but cannot see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have ears, but cannot hear,
    nor is there breath in their mouths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who make them will be like them,
    and so will all who trust in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All you Israelites, praise the Lord;
    house of Aaron, praise the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
house of Levi, praise the Lord;
    you who fear him, praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to the Lord from Zion,
    to him who dwells in Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good.
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the God of gods.
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord of lords:
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to him who alone does great wonders,
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who by his understanding made the heavens,
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who spread out the earth upon the waters,
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who made the great lights—
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the sun to govern the day,
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the moon and stars to govern the night;
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to him who struck down the firstborn of Egypt
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and brought Israel out from among them
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with a mighty hand and outstretched arm;
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to him who divided the Red Sea asunder
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and brought Israel through the midst of it,
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but swept Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea;
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to him who led his people through the wilderness;
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to him who struck down great kings,
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and killed mighty kings—
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sihon king of the Amorites
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and Og king of Bashan—
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and gave their land as an inheritance,
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
an inheritance to his servant Israel.
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He remembered us in our low estate
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and freed us from our enemies.
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gives food to every creature.
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the God of heaven.
His love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the rivers of Babylon we sat and wept
    when we remembered Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There on the poplars
    we hung our harps,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How can we sing the songs of the Lord
    while in a foreign land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I forget you, Jerusalem,
    may my right hand forget its skill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth
    if I do not remember you,
if I do not consider Jerusalem
    my highest joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, Lord, what the Edomites did
    on the day Jerusalem fell.
“Tear it down,” they cried,
    “tear it down to its foundations!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Daughter Babylon, doomed to destruction,
    happy is the one who repays you
    according to what you have done to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy is the one who seizes your infants
    and dashes them against the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise you, Lord, with all my heart;
    before the “gods” I will sing your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bow down toward your holy temple
    and will praise your name
    for your unfailing love and your faithfulness,
for you have so exalted your solemn decree
    that it surpasses your fame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I called, you answered me;
    you greatly emboldened me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May all the kings of the earth praise you, Lord,
    when they hear what you have decreed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they sing of the ways of the Lord,
    for the glory of the Lord is great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though the Lord is exalted, he looks kindly on the lowly;
    though lofty, he sees them from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I walk in the midst of trouble,
    you preserve my life.
You stretch out your hand against the anger of my foes;
    with your right hand you save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You have searched me, Lord,
    and you know me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You know when I sit and when I rise;
    you perceive my thoughts from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You discern my going out and my lying down;
    you are familiar with all my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before a word is on my tongue
    you, Lord, know it completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You hem me in behind and before,
    and you lay your hand upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Such knowledge is too wonderful for me,
    too lofty for me to attain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where can I go from your Spirit?
    Where can I flee from your presence?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I go up to the heavens, you are there;
    if I make my bed in the depths, you are there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I rise on the wings of the dawn,
    if I settle on the far side of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
even there your hand will guide me,
    your right hand will hold me fast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I say, “Surely the darkness will hide me
    and the light become night around me,”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For you created my inmost being;
    you knit me together in my mother’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My frame was not hidden from you
    when I was made in the secret place,
    when I was woven together in the depths of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How precious to me are your thoughts, God!
    How vast is the sum of them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Were I to count them,
    they would outnumber the grains of sand—
    when I awake, I am still with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If only you, God, would slay the wicked!
    Away from me, you who are bloodthirsty!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They speak of you with evil intent;
    your adversaries misuse your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do I not hate those who hate you, Lord,
    and abhor those who are in rebellion against you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have nothing but hatred for them;
    I count them my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Search me, God, and know my heart;
    test me and know my anxious thoughts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See if there is any offensive way in me,
    and lead me in the way everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue me, Lord, from evildoers;
    protect me from the violent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who devise evil plans in their hearts
    and stir up war every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They make their tongues as sharp as a serpent’s;
    the poison of vipers is on their lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I say to the Lord, “You are my God.”
    Hear, Lord, my cry for mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sovereign Lord, my strong deliverer,
    you shield my head in the day of battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not grant the wicked their desires, Lord;
    do not let their plans succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who surround me proudly rear their heads;
    may the mischief of their lips engulf them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May slanderers not be established in the land;
    may disaster hunt down the violent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know that the Lord secures justice for the poor
    and upholds the cause of the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the righteous will praise your name,
    and the upright will live in your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call to you, Lord, come quickly to me;
    hear me when I call to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my prayer be set before you like incense;
    may the lifting up of my hands be like the evening sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set a guard over my mouth, Lord;
    keep watch over the door of my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let my heart be drawn to what is evil
    so that I take part in wicked deeds
along with those who are evildoers;
    do not let me eat their delicacies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let a righteous man strike me—that is a kindness;
    let him rebuke me—that is oil on my head.
My head will not refuse it,
    for my prayer will still be against the deeds of evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their rulers will be thrown down from the cliffs,
    and the wicked will learn that my words were well spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will say, “As one plows and breaks up the earth,
    so our bones have been scattered at the mouth of the grave.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my eyes are fixed on you, Sovereign Lord;
    in you I take refuge—do not give me over to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep me safe from the traps set by evildoers,
    from the snares they have laid for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the wicked fall into their own nets,
    while I pass by in safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry aloud to the Lord;
    I lift up my voice to the Lord for mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I pour out before him my complaint;
    before him I tell my trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my spirit grows faint within me,
    it is you who watch over my way.
In the path where I walk
    people have hidden a snare for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to my cry,
    for I am in desperate need;
rescue me from those who pursue me,
    for they are too strong for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set me free from my prison,
    that I may praise your name.
Then the righteous will gather about me
    because of your goodness to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, hear my prayer,
    listen to my cry for mercy;
in your faithfulness and righteousness
    come to my relief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not bring your servant into judgment,
    for no one living is righteous before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The enemy pursues me,
    he crushes me to the ground;
he makes me dwell in the darkness
    like those long dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So my spirit grows faint within me;
    my heart within me is dismayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I spread out my hands to you;
    I thirst for you like a parched land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer me quickly, Lord;
    my spirit fails.
Do not hide your face from me
    or I will be like those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the morning bring me word of your unfailing love,
    for I have put my trust in you.
Show me the way I should go,
    for to you I entrust my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue me from my enemies, Lord,
    for I hide myself in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me to do your will,
    for you are my God;
may your good Spirit
    lead me on level ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your name’s sake, Lord, preserve my life;
    in your righteousness, bring me out of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to the Lord my Rock,
    who trains my hands for war,
    my fingers for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is my loving God and my fortress,
    my stronghold and my deliverer,
my shield, in whom I take refuge,
    who subdues peoples under me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, what are human beings that you care for them,
    mere mortals that you think of them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like a breath;
    their days are like a fleeting shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Part your heavens, Lord, and come down;
    touch the mountains, so that they smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Send forth lightning and scatter the enemy;
    shoot your arrows and rout them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
whose mouths are full of lies,
    whose right hands are deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing a new song to you, my God;
    on the ten-stringed lyre I will make music to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to the One who gives victory to kings,
    who delivers his servant David.
From the deadly sword
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
deliver me;
    rescue me from the hands of foreigners
whose mouths are full of lies,
    whose right hands are deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then our sons in their youth
    will be like well-nurtured plants,
and our daughters will be like pillars
    carved to adorn a palace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our barns will be filled
    with every kind of provision.
Our sheep will increase by thousands,
    by tens of thousands in our fields;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
our oxen will draw heavy loads.
There will be no breaching of walls,
    no going into captivity,
    no cry of distress in our streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the people of whom this is true;
    blessed is the people whose God is the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will exalt you, my God the King;
    I will praise your name for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every day I will praise you
    and extol your name for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is the Lord and most worthy of praise;
    his greatness no one can fathom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One generation commends your works to another;
    they tell of your mighty acts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They speak of the glorious splendor of your majesty—
    and I will meditate on your wonderful works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They tell of the power of your awesome works—
    and I will proclaim your great deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They celebrate your abundant goodness
    and joyfully sing of your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is gracious and compassionate,
    slow to anger and rich in love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is good to all;
    he has compassion on all he has made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your works praise you, Lord;
    your faithful people extol you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They tell of the glory of your kingdom
    and speak of your might,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that all people may know of your mighty acts
    and the glorious splendor of your kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
    and your dominion endures through all generations.
The Lord is trustworthy in all he promises
    and faithful in all he does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord upholds all who fall
    and lifts up all who are bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of all look to you,
    and you give them their food at the proper time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You open your hand
    and satisfy the desires of every living thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is righteous in all his ways
    and faithful in all he does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is near to all who call on him,
    to all who call on him in truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He fulfills the desires of those who fear him;
    he hears their cry and saves them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord watches over all who love him,
    but all the wicked he will destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will speak in praise of the Lord.
    Let every creature praise his holy name
    for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord.
Praise the Lord, my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise the Lord all my life;
    I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not put your trust in princes,
    in human beings, who cannot save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When their spirit departs, they return to the ground;
    on that very day their plans come to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those whose help is the God of Jacob,
    whose hope is in the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the Maker of heaven and earth,
    the sea, and everything in them—
    he remains faithful forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He upholds the cause of the oppressed
    and gives food to the hungry.
The Lord sets prisoners free,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the Lord gives sight to the blind,
the Lord lifts up those who are bowed down,
    the Lord loves the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord watches over the foreigner
    and sustains the fatherless and the widow,
    but he frustrates the ways of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord reigns forever,
    your God, O Zion, for all generations.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord.
How good it is to sing praises to our God,
    how pleasant and fitting to praise him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord builds up Jerusalem;
    he gathers the exiles of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He heals the brokenhearted
    and binds up their wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He determines the number of the stars
    and calls them each by name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is our Lord and mighty in power;
    his understanding has no limit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord sustains the humble
    but casts the wicked to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord with grateful praise;
    make music to our God on the harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He provides food for the cattle
    and for the young ravens when they call.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His pleasure is not in the strength of the horse,
    nor his delight in the legs of the warrior;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the Lord delights in those who fear him,
    who put their hope in his unfailing love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Extol the Lord, Jerusalem;
    praise your God, Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He strengthens the bars of your gates
    and blesses your people within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He grants peace to your borders
    and satisfies you with the finest of wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sends his command to the earth;
    his word runs swiftly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spreads the snow like wool
    and scatters the frost like ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hurls down his hail like pebbles.
    Who can withstand his icy blast?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sends his word and melts them;
    he stirs up his breezes, and the waters flow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has revealed his word to Jacob,
    his laws and decrees to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him, all his angels;
    praise him, all his heavenly hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him, sun and moon;
    praise him, all you shining stars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him, you highest heavens
    and you waters above the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise the name of the Lord,
    for at his command they were created,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he established them for ever and ever—
    he issued a decree that will never pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord from the earth,
    you great sea creatures and all ocean depths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lightning and hail, snow and clouds,
    stormy winds that do his bidding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you mountains and all hills,
    fruit trees and all cedars,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
wild animals and all cattle,
    small creatures and flying birds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
kings of the earth and all nations,
    you princes and all rulers on earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
young men and women,
    old men and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And he has raised up for his people a horn,
    the praise of all his faithful servants,
    of Israel, the people close to his heart.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord.
Sing to the Lord a new song,
    his praise in the assembly of his faithful people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Israel rejoice in their Maker;
    let the people of Zion be glad in their King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise his name with dancing
    and make music to him with timbrel and harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord takes delight in his people;
    he crowns the humble with victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let his faithful people rejoice in this honor
    and sing for joy on their beds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the praise of God be in their mouths
    and a double-edged sword in their hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to inflict vengeance on the nations
    and punishment on the peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to bind their kings with fetters,
    their nobles with shackles of iron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to carry out the sentence written against them—
    this is the glory of all his faithful people.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him for his acts of power;
    praise him for his surpassing greatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him with the sounding of the trumpet,
    praise him with the harp and lyre,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
praise him with timbrel and dancing,
    praise him with the strings and pipe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
praise him with the clash of cymbals,
    praise him with resounding cymbals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let everything that has breath praise the Lord.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
